BAR.TER.SCHL.3034.FE.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 30-34, female
BAR.TER.SCHL.3034.FE.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 30-34, female is the average years of tertiary education completed among females age 30-34.

SP.SEC.LTOT.FE.IN.name: Population, low secondary, female
SP.SEC.LTOT.FE.IN.sourceNote: School age population. Lower secondary. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to lower secondary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

BAR.SCHL.25UP.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.25UP.FE.name: average years of total schooling, 25+, female
BAR.SCHL.25UP.FE.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 25+, female is the average years of education completed among females over age 25.

HH.DHS.OOST.DO.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOST.DO.R.name: DHS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Rural
HH.DHS.OOST.DO.R.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Rural is the proportion of rural out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

LO.PASEC.FRE5.HIG.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.FRE5.HIG.name: PASEC: 5th grade students above the Knowledge Base Rate on the French language scale (above 40% of answers correct) (%), total
LO.PASEC.FRE5.HIG.sourceNote: Indicator is the share of students who score above the Knowledge Base Rate, which is the proportion of pupils who achieve a minimum learning goal, based on the programs of the level selected, appropriate to the scale of the tests used.

MYS.PROP.4549.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.TER.MF.name: proportion, 45-49, total, tertiary
MYS.PROP.4549.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population age 45-49 with tertiary education.

UIS.AIR.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for gross intake ratio. Primary
UIS.AIR.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross intake ratio. Primary is the ratio of the female gross intake ratio for primary to the male gross intake ratio for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

SP.POP.0510.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 5-10, total
SP.POP.0510.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 5-10, total is the total population age 5-10.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.name: average years of primary schooling, 45-49, total
BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 45-49, total is the average years of primary education completed among people age 45-49.

SP.POP.0711.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 7-11, male is the total number of males age 7-11.

BAR.NOED.2024.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 20-24 with no education
BAR.NOED.2024.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 20-24 with no education

MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 65+, male, secondary
MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65+, male, secondary is the total number of males over age 65 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 65+, total, secondary
MYS.POP.65UP.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65+, total, secondary is the total number of people over age 65 (in thousands) with secondary education.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G7.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 7. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G7.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 7. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.56.F200.name: Enrolment in humanities and arts. Tertiary. Total
UIS.E.56.F200.sourceNote: Enrolment in humanities and arts. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary humanities and arts programs.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G5.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G5.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Total
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.3034.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.3034.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 30-34 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.3034.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 30-34 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

SE.PRE.ENRR.MA.name: School enrollment, preprimary, male (% gross)
SE.PRE.ENRR.MA.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Pre-primary. Male is the total male enrollment in pre-primary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of official pre-primary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

MYS.PROP.6569.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.FE.name: proportion, 65-69, female, no education
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 65-69, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 65-69 with no education.

SE.XPD.STCH.ZS.name: Spending on teaching materials, secondary (% of secondary expenditure)
SE.XPD.STCH.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. Teaching materials is the share of public current expenditure for secondary education devoted to teaching materials.

UIS.UAPP.1.M.name: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male
UIS.UAPP.1.M.sourceNote: Under-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male is the percentage of the male primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is under the official primary school age.

MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 40-44, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 40-44, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 40-44 with secondary education.

LO.TIMSS.SCI8.BL.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)'s Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
LO.TIMSS.SCI8.BL.name: TIMSS: Eighth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark of science achievement (%)
LO.TIMSS.SCI8.BL.sourceNote: TIMSS: Eighth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark of science achievement (%) is the share of 8th grade students scoring below 400 on the science assessment. This indicator is calculated by subtracting the share of students reaching the low international benchmark from 100.

SE.SEC.REPT.ZS.name: Repeaters, secondary, total (% of total enrollment)
SE.SEC.REPT.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. All grades. Total is the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of repeaters in all grades of secondary education by the total enrolment of secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

LO.PISA.SCI.LOW.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.SCI.LOW.name: PISA:Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the science scale (%)
LO.PISA.SCI.LOW.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the science scale (%) is the percentage of students below Level 1 (below 334.94 score points) on the science scale.

UIS.LPP.AG15T24.name: Youth illiterate population. % female
UIS.LPP.AG15T24.sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. % female is the share of the youth illiterate population that is female.

UIS.LP.AG15T24.M.name: Youth illiterate population. Male
UIS.LP.AG15T24.M.sourceNote: Youth illiterate population. Male is the total number of males between age 15 and age 24 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

LO.PIRLS.REA.MA.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)
LO.PIRLS.REA.MA.name: PIRLS:Mean performance on the reading scale, male
LO.PIRLS.REA.MA.sourceNote: Mean performance on the reading scale, male

SP.POP.AG24.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 24, total
SP.POP.AG24.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 24, total refers to the total population at the specified age.

HH.MICS.GAR.456.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.GAR.456.M.name: MICS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Male
HH.MICS.GAR.456.M.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Male is the number of male post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the population of males of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

HH.MICS.GAR.456.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.GAR.456.F.name: MICS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Female
HH.MICS.GAR.456.F.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Female is the number of female post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the population of females of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G8.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G8.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

HH.MICS.GAR.456.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.GAR.456.R.name: MICS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Rural
HH.MICS.GAR.456.R.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Rural is the number of rural post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the rural population of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G8.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G8.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.LR.AG15T99.GPI.name: Gender parity index for adult literacy rate
UIS.LR.AG15T99.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for adult literacy rate is the ratio of female adult literacy rate to the male adult literacy rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

HH.MICS.GAR.456.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.GAR.456.U.name: MICS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Urban
HH.MICS.GAR.456.U.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Urban is the number of urban post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the urban population of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.EGGR.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for expected gross primary graduation ratio
UIS.EGGR.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for expected gross primary graduation ratio is the ratio of female expected gross primary graduation rate to the male expected gross primary graduation rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.5054.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.5054.name: average years of secondary schooling, 50-54, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.5054.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 50-54, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 50-54.

SP.POP.0305.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 3- 5, total
SP.POP.0305.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 3-5, total is the total population age 3-5.

BAR.PRM.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)
BAR.PRM.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)

HH.DHS.YRS.1519.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.name: DHS: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.sourceNote: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19 is the number of years of formal schooling received, on average, by the population of the given age group.

UIS.T.5.A.F.name: Teaching staff in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female
UIS.T.5.A.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private ISCED 5A tertiary education institutions. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

HH.MICS.OOST.DO.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.R.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Rural
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.R.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Rural is the proportion of rural out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

HH.MICS.OOST.DO.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.U.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Urban
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.U.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Urban is the proportion of urban out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

HH.MICS.OOST.DO.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.F.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Female
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.F.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Female is the proportion of female out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 15-19 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary
BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 15-19 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

MYS.POP.7579.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7579.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 75-79, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.7579.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 75-79, female, tertiary is the total number of females age 75-79 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

HH.MICS.OOST.DO.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.M.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Male
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.M.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Male is the proportion of male out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

HH.MICS.OOS.1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOS.1.name: MICS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary
HH.MICS.OOS.1.sourceNote: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary is the number of children in the official primary school age range who are not attending primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of children of the official primary school age range. By definition, children in the official primary-age range, who are attending pre-primary education, are considered out-of-school. The sum of the net primary attendance rate and the proportion out of school do not add to 100 percent because the net primary attendance rate does not count students who are in secondary.

UIS.AFR.GTCTR.2.F.name: Africa Dataset: Ratio of teacher training graduates to teachers in service. Lower secondary. Public and private. Female
UIS.AFR.GTCTR.2.F.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.POP.6064.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 60-64, female, primary
MYS.POP.6064.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 60-64, female, primary is the total number of females age 60-64 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.AFR.GTCTR.2.M.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 45-49, male, primary
MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, male, primary is the proportion of the male population age 45-49 with primary education.

UIS.AFR.NTP.1.PU.M.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of newly recruited teachers. Primary. Public. Male
UIS.AFR.NTP.1.PU.M.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 25+, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 25+, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population over age 25 with secondary education.

MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 25+, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.25UP.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 25+, total, secondary is the proportion of the population over age 25 with secondary education.

SP.POP.AG07.MA.UN.name: Population, aged  7, male
SP.POP.AG07.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 7, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.MA.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.MA.name: PISA:Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), male
LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), male is the percentage of male students at Level 6 (above 669.30 score points) on the mathematics scale.

LO.LLECE.SCI6.LOW.MA.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.SCI6.LOW.MA.name: LLECE: 6th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the science scale (%), male
LO.LLECE.SCI6.LOW.MA.sourceNote: 6th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the science scale (%), male

UIS.AFR.NTP.1.PU.F.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 60-64, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 60-64, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 60-64.

SP.POP.0612.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 6-12, male
SP.POP.0612.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 6-12, male is the total number of males age 6-12.

MYS.POP.1544.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1544.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 15-44, female, primary
MYS.POP.1544.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-44, female, primary is the total number of females age 15-44 (in thousands) with primary education.

LO.LLECE.REA6.MA.name: LLECE:Mean performance on the reading scale for 6th grade students, male

UIS.DR.1.G3.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 3. Total
UIS.DR.1.G3.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 3. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

BAR.PRM.ICMP.6569.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.ICMP.6569.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 65-69 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)
BAR.PRM.ICMP.6569.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 65-69 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)

UIS.FTP.2.name: Percentage female teachers.  Lower secondary
UIS.FTP.2.sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Lower secondary is the number of female teachers at the lower secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the lower secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.DR.1.G4.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 4. Total
UIS.DR.1.G4.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 4. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

BAR.TER.ICMP.3539.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.ICMP.3539.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)
BAR.TER.ICMP.3539.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)

UIS.FTP.4.name: Percentage female teachers. Post-secondary/non-tertiary
UIS.FTP.4.sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Post-secondary/non-tertiary is the number of female teachers at the post-secondary/non-tertiary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the post-secondary/non-tertiary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.DR.1.G5.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.DR.1.G5.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 5. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

SP.POP.1017.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 10-17, male
SP.POP.1017.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10-17, male is the total number of males age 10-17.

MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 60-64, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 60-64, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 60-64 with secondary education.

MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 60-64, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 60-64, total, secondary is the proportion of the population age 60-64 with secondary education.

SE.PRM.UNER.FE.name: Children out of school, primary, female
SE.PRM.UNER.FE.sourceNote: Out-of-school children of primary school age. Female is the total number of female primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in either primary or secondary schools.

UIS.E.0.AgI0.F.name: Pupils of the official school age.  Pre-primary.  Female
UIS.E.0.AgI0.F.sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Pre-primary. Female is the total number of female pre-primary students who are of the official pre-primary school age. NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

MYS.PROP.1519.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.FE.name: proportion, 15-19, female, no education
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-19, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 15-19 with no education.

MYS.POP.1564.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1564.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 15-64, female, secondary
MYS.POP.1564.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-64, female, secondary is the total number of females age 15-64 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SP.POP.1015.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 10-15, female
SP.POP.1015.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10-15, female is the total number of females age 10-15.

UIS.T.5.B.name: Teaching staff in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
UIS.T.5.B.sourceNote: Teaching staff in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private ISCED 5B tertiary education institutions. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.FE.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.FE.name: PASEC: Mean performance on the mathematics scale (100 points) for 5th grade students, female
LO.PASEC.MAT5.FE.sourceNote: PASEC: Mean performance on the mathematics scale (100 points) for 5th grade students, female is the average score on the 100 point mathematics scale for female 5th grade students. Note: Average differences are only significant between males and females in Benin, Gabon, Burkina Faso, Senegal, Burundi, Cote d'Ivoire, and Comoros. Since comparison is suggested by giving average scores for males/females, please take into account that these are only raw effects of gender. PASEC uses econometric models to validate the effect of gender in achievement.

HH.DHS.OOST.X.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOST.X.name: DHS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school
HH.DHS.OOST.X.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school is the percentage of out-of-school primary-school-age children who have never attended school and are not likely to enter school in the future. Since no survey can say definitively that a school-age person will never attend school, this is a probabilistic indicator. The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

UIS.SLE.56.GPI.name: Gender parity index for school life expectancy.  Tertiary.
UIS.SLE.56.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Tertiary is the ratio of female school life expectancy (tertiary) to the male school life expectancy (tertiary). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.2529.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.2529.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 25-29, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.2529.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 25-29, female is the average years of primary education completed among females age 25-29.

LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.name: SACMEQ:Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%)
LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.sourceNote: Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%)

SP.PRE.TOTL.MA.IN.name: Population, pre-primary, male
SP.PRE.TOTL.MA.IN.sourceNote: School age population. Pre-primary. Male is the male population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to pre-primary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

MYS.PROP.15UP.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.15UP.TER.MF.name: proportion, 15+, total, tertiary
MYS.PROP.15UP.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15+, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population over age 15 with tertiary education.

MYS.PROP.15UP.TER.MA.name: proportion, 15+, male, tertiary
MYS.PROP.15UP.TER.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15+, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population over age 15 with tertiary education.

UIS.E.1.PR.name: Enrolment in primary. Private
UIS.E.1.PR.sourceNote: Enrolment in primary. Private is the total student enrolment in private primary educational institutions.

MYS.POP.5559.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.NED.MA.name: population in thousand, 55-59, male, no education
MYS.POP.5559.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, male, no education is the total number of males age 55-59 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.POP.5559.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 55-59, total, no education
MYS.POP.5559.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, total, no education is the total number of people age 55-59 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.E.3.GPV.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in general programmes at public and private upper secondary education institutions.

HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.name: MICS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Urban
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Urban measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.name: MICS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Rural
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Rural measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

MYS.PROP.25UP.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.25UP.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 25+, total, primary
MYS.PROP.25UP.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 25+, total, primary is the proportion of the population over age 25 with primary education.

UIS.XSPENDP.56.FDPUB.FNNONS.name: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
UIS.XSPENDP.56.FDPUB.FNNONS.sourceNote: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is other current education spending (excluding salaries) expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Other Current Expenditures."

HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.M.name: MICS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Male
HH.MICS.YRS.15UP.GIN.M.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Male measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

MYS.PROP.25UP.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 25+, male, primary

UIS.T.4.V.F.name: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female
UIS.T.4.V.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private post-secondary education institutions (ISCED 4). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.E.56.F140.name: Enrolment in education. Tertiary. Total
UIS.E.56.F140.sourceNote: Enrolment in education. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary education programs.

SE.PRM.TCAQ.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Primary. Female is the number of female teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female teachers at the primary level.

UIS.XNATURCP.23.FDPUB.FNS.name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. All personnel salaries
UIS.XNATURCP.23.FDPUB.FNS.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in secondary education. All personnel salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on secondary education devoted to salaries.

MYS.PROP.1544.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-44, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 15-44 with no education.

UIS.R.23.GPV.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. All grades. Female is the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

UIS.REPR.1.G1.M.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Male
UIS.REPR.1.G1.M.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Male is the proportion of male pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.R.1.G6.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 6. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

UIS.REPR.1.G1.F.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Female
UIS.REPR.1.G1.F.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

IT.CMP.PCMP.P2.sourceNote: Personal computers are self-contained computers designed to be used by a single individual.

MYS.POP.1544.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1544.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 15-44, total, secondary
MYS.POP.1544.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-44, total, secondary is the total number of people age 15-44 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.1544.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 15-44, male, secondary

SP.SEC.TOTL.FE.IN.name: Population, secondary, female
SP.SEC.TOTL.FE.IN.sourceNote: School age population. Secondary. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to secondary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. HH.DHS.GAR.456.Q4.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Quintile 4 is the number of quintile 4 post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 4 population of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.AIRE.1.GLAST.GPI.name: Gender parity index for expected primary completion rate
UIS.AIRE.1.GLAST.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for expected primary completion rate is the ratio of female expected primary completion rate to the male expected primary completion rate. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females. This indicator is also known as "Gender parity index for expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary."

SP.POP.1118.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 11-18, female

HH.MICS.SCR.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.SCR.U.name: MICS: Secondary completion rate. Urban
HH.MICS.SCR.U.sourceNote: Secondary completion rate. Urban is the total number of urban students of any age in last grade of secondary school, minus the number of urban repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of urban children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of secondary school.

HH.MICS.SCR.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.SCR.R.name: MICS: Secondary completion rate. Rural
HH.MICS.SCR.R.sourceNote: Secondary completion rate. Rural is the total number of rural students of any age in last grade of secondary school, minus the number of rural repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of rural children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of secondary school.

UIS.E.23.V.PU.F.name: Enrolment in total secondary. Public. Technical/vocational programmes. Female
UIS.E.23.V.PU.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public. Technical/vocational programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in technical/vocational programmes in public secondary education institutions.

HH.MICS.SCR.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.SCR.F.name: MICS: Secondary completion rate. Female
HH.MICS.SCR.F.sourceNote: Secondary completion rate. Female is the total number of female students of any age in last grade of secondary school, minus the number of female repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of female children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of secondary school.

HH.MICS.SCR.M.name: MICS: Secondary completion rate. Male
HH.MICS.SCR.M.sourceNote: Secondary completion rate. Male is the total number of male students of any age in last grade of secondary school, minus the number of male repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of male children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of secondary school.

UIS.REPP.1.G4.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Female
UIS.REPP.1.G4.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

LO.PISA.SCI.HIG.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the science scale (%), male is the percentage of male students at Level 6 (above 707.93 score points) on the science scale.

SE.PRM.CMPL.FE.ZS.name: Gross primary graduation ratio, female
SE.PRM.CMPL.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Gross primary graduation ratio. Female is the number of female graduates from the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the female population at the theoretical graduation age. The ratio can exceed 100% due to over-aged and under-aged children who enter primary school for the first time early/late or/and repeat a grade.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G6.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 6. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G6.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 6. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

MYS.POP.7579.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7579.TER.MF.name: population in thousand, 75-79, total, tertiary
MYS.POP.7579.TER.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 75-79, total, tertiary is the total number of people age 75-79 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.ROFST.2.name: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Total
UIS.ROFST.2.sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of lower secondary school age (%). Total is the number of children of official lower secondary school age who are not enrolled in lower secondary school expressed as a percentage of the population of official lower secondary school age.

SE.SEC.NENR.FE.name: School enrollment, secondary, female (% net)
SE.SEC.NENR.FE.sourceNote: Net enrolment rate. Secondary. All programmes. Female is the ratio of female children of the official secondary school age who are enrolled in secondary school to the female population of the official secondary school age.

UIS.ROFST.1.name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Total
UIS.ROFST.1.sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Total is the number of children of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G6.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 6. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G6.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 6. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.5.B.name: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
UIS.E.5.B.sourceNote: Enrolment in 5B tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private 5B tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5B tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are practically oriented/occupationally specific and are mainly designed for participants to acquire the practical skills, and know-how needed for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades. The successful completion of tertiary 5B programmes usually provides the participants with a labor-market relevant qualification.

UIS.E.56.F600.F.name: Enrolment in agriculture. Tertiary. Female
UIS.E.56.F600.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in agriculture. Tertiary. Female is the total number of females enrolled in tertiary agriculture programs.

UIS.E.1.Guk.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in primary. Grade unspecified. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in unspecified grades of primary education.

UIS.E.2.V.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in technical/vocational programmes at public lower secondary education institutions.

HH.DHS.NIR.1.name: DHS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education
HH.DHS.NIR.1.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education is the number of new pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the children of official entrance age to primary education.

BAR.SEC.CMPT.5559.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 55-59 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary

SE.PRE.ENRL.MA.sourceNote: Enrolment in pre-primary. Public and private. All programmes. Male is the total number of male students enrolled in public and private pre-primary education institutions.

HH.DHS.NAR.1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.NAR.1.name: DHS: Net attendance rate. Primary
HH.DHS.NAR.1.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Total is the proportion of children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

MYS.PROP.3539.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.3539.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 35-39, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.3539.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 35-39, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 35-39 with secondary education.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.2024.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 20-24 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

UIS.E.23.GPV.G3.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 3. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in Grade 3 of secondary education.

SP.POP.1016.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 10-16, total
SP.POP.1016.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10-16, total is the total population age 10-16.

MYS.PROP.15UP.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 15+, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.15UP.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15+, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population over age 15 with secondary education.

SE.SEC.DURS.sourceNote: Duration of secondary education is the number of grades (years) in secondary education (ISCED 2 & 3).

MYS.PROP.15UP.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 15+, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.15UP.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15+, total, secondary is the proportion of the population over age 15 with secondary education.

SE.TER.GRAD.ED.FE.ZS.name: Graduates in education, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.ED.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary graduates in education is the share of all female tertiary graduates who studied education.

UIS.TRTP.2.GPI.name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Lower secondary
UIS.TRTP.2.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Lower secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for lower secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for lower secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.

MYS.PROP.1564.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 15-64, total, primary
MYS.PROP.1564.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, total, primary is the proportion of the population age 15-64 with primary education.

UIS.E.56.F600.name: Enrolment in agriculture. Tertiary. Total
UIS.E.56.F600.sourceNote: Enrolment in agriculture. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary agriculture programs.

MYS.POP.5054.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5054.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 50-54, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.5054.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 50-54, female, tertiary is the total number of females age 50-54 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q5.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q5.name: DHS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 5
HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q5.sourceNote: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 5 is the number of quintile 5 children in the official primary school age range who are not attending primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of quintile 5 children of the official primary school age range. By definition, children in the official primary-age range, who are attending pre-primary education, are considered out-of-school. The sum of the net primary attendance rate and the proportion out of school do not add to 100 percent because the net primary attendance rate does not count students who are in secondary.

HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q4.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q4.name: DHS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 4
HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q4.sourceNote: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 4 is the number of quintile 4 children in the official primary school age range who are not attending primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of quintile 4 children of the official primary school age range. By definition, children in the official primary-age range, who are attending pre-primary education, are considered out-of-school. The sum of the net primary attendance rate and the proportion out of school do not add to 100 percent because the net primary attendance rate does not count students who are in secondary.

UIS.E.3.V.name: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public and private. Technical/vocational programmes. Total
UIS.E.3.V.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public and private. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in technical/vocational programmes at public and private upper secondary education institutions.

UIS.E.5.A.name: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
UIS.E.5.A.sourceNote: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private 5A tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5A tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and profession with high skills requirements.

HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q1.name: DHS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 1

HH.DHS.OOS.1.Q2.name: DHS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Quintile 2

UIS.REPR.1.G2.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 2. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.REPR.1.G1.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G1.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 1. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

SE.PRM.ENRL.TC.ZS.name: Pupil-teacher ratio, primary
SE.PRM.ENRL.TC.ZS.sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Primary is the number of pupils enrolled in primary school divided by the number of primary school teachers.

UIS.REPR.1.G7.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 7. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G7.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 7. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.REPR.1.G6.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 6. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G6.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 6. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.REPR.1.G5.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G5.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 5. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.REPR.1.G4.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 4. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G4.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 4. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

SE.ADT.LITR.ZS.name: Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above)
SE.ADT.LITR.ZS.sourceNote: Adult (15+) literacy rate (%). Total is the percentage of the population age 15 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of literates aged 15 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

HH.DHS.OOST.X.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOST.X.Q1.name: DHS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 1
HH.DHS.OOST.X.Q1.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 1 is the percentage of quintile 1 out-of-school primary-school-age children who have never attended school and are not likely to enter school in the future. Since no survey can say definitively that a school-age person will never attend school, this is a probabilistic indicator. The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

Female is the total number of female teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private secondary education institutions (ISCED 2 and 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.AY.EM.sourceNote: Ending month of the academic year (Questionnaire A)

BAR.SCHL.1519.name: average years of total schooling, 15-19, total
BAR.SCHL.1519.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 15-19, total is the average years of education completed among people age 15-19.

NY.GDP.PCAP.CD.sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.
NY.GDP.PCAP.CD.name: GDP per capita (current US$)
NY.GDP.PCAP.CD.sourceNote: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G9.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 9. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

MYS.PROP.4044.TER.MA.name: proportion, 40-44, male, tertiary
MYS.PROP.4044.TER.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 40-44, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population age 40-44 with tertiary education.

BAR.SCHL.5054.name: average years of total schooling, 50-54, total
BAR.SCHL.5054.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 50-54, total is the average years of education completed among people age 50-54.

MYS.PROP.4044.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 40-44, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population age 40-44 with tertiary education.

UIS.FEP.5.A.name: Percentage of female students.  Tertiary ISCED 5A
UIS.FEP.5.A.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5A is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 5A) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 5A) education level in a given school year.

UIS.FEP.5.B.name: Percentage of female students.  Tertiary ISCED 5B
UIS.FEP.5.B.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 5B is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 5B) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 5B) education level in a given school year.

UIS.OE.56.40510.name: Outbound mobile students (students from a given country studying abroad). Tertiary
UIS.OE.56.40510.sourceNote: Outbound mobile students (students from a given country studying abroad). Tertiary is the total number of students from a given country studying abroad.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.name: average years of primary schooling, 25+, total
BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 25+, total is the average years of primary education completed among people over age 25.

UIS.SR.1.GLAST.GPI.name: Gender parity index for survival rate to last grade of primary
UIS.SR.1.GLAST.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for survival rate to the last grade of primary is the ratio of female survival rate to grade the last grade of primary to the male survival rate to grade the last grade of primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

UIS.E.3.GPV.PU.F.name: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. General programmes. Female
UIS.E.3.GPV.PU.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. General programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in general programmes at public upper secondary education institutions.

UIS.SLE.123.GPI.name: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to secondary.
UIS.SLE.123.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for school life expectancy. Primary to secondary is the ratio of female school life expectancy (primary to secondary) to the male school life expectancy (primary to secondary). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.25UP.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.25UP.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 25+ with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.25UP.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 25+ with primary schooling. Completed Primary

NY.GNP.PCAP.PP.CD.sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.
NY.GNP.PCAP.PP.CD.name: GNI per capita, PPP (current international $)
NY.GNP.PCAP.PP.CD.sourceNote: GNI per capita based on purchasing power parity (PPP). PPP GNI is gross national income (GNI) converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GNI as a U.S. dollar has in the United States. GNI is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. Data are in current international dollars based on the 2011 ICP round.

UIS.FOSEP.56.F500.name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction
UIS.FOSEP.56.F500.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

SP.POP.AG03.TO.UN.name: Population, aged  3, total
SP.POP.AG03.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 3, total refers to the total population at the specified age.

UIS.OFSPPT.1.F.name: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Female
UIS.OFSPPT.1.F.sourceNote: Out-of-school children of primary school age enrolled in pre-primary education. Female is the total number of female primary-school-age children who are enrolled in pre-primary education.

UIS.T.3.GPV.F.name: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female
UIS.T.3.GPV.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in general programmes in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.1519.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.1519.name: average years of primary schooling, 15-19, total
BAR.PRM.SCHL.1519.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 15-19, total is the average years of primary education completed among people age 15-19.

MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MA.name: population in thousand, 65+, male, tertiary
MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65+, male, tertiary is the total number of males over age 65 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.REPP.1.G7.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Male
UIS.REPP.1.G7.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MF.name: population in thousand, 65+, total, tertiary
MYS.POP.65UP.TER.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65+, total, tertiary is the total number of people over age 65 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.REPP.1.G7.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Female
UIS.REPP.1.G7.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

MYS.PROP.3034.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.3034.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 30 - 34, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.3034.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 30-34, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population age 30-34 with secondary education.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.FE.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.FE.name: PASEC: 5th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (less than 25% of answers correct) (%), female
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.FE.sourceNote: Indicator is for Failure Rate on the PASEC exam, which is less than the score a pupil could obtain by completing the PASEC test randomly.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.2024.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.2024.name: average years of secondary schooling, 20-24, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.2024.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 20-24, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 20-24.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G3.F.name: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Female
UIS.R.23.GPV.G3.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

NY.GNP.MKTP.PP.CD.sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.
NY.GNP.MKTP.PP.CD.name: GNI, PPP (current international $)
NY.GNP.MKTP.PP.CD.sourceNote: PPP GNI (formerly PPP GNP) is gross national income (GNI) converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GNI as a U.S. dollar has in the United States. Gross national income is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. Data are in current international dollars. For most economies PPP figures are extrapolated from the 2011 International Comparison Program (ICP) benchmark estimates or imputed using a statistical model based on the 2011 ICP. For 47 high- and upper middle-income economies conversion factors are provided by Eurostat and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

UIS.FOSEP.56.F500.F.name: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction
UIS.FOSEP.56.F500.F.sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in engineering, manufacturing and construction is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in engineering, manufacturing and construction programmes.

UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WELEC.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of schools with electricity. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WELEC.sourceNote: Share of primary schools with access to permanent sources of electrical power (i.e. grid/mains connection, wind, water, solar, permanently fuel-powered generator, etc.). Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.7579.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 75-79, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.7579.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 75-79, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 75-79.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G7.F.name: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 7. Female
UIS.R.23.GPV.G7.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 7. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

SP.POP.1116.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 11-16, total is the total population age 11-16.

BAR.SCHL.25UP.name: average years of total schooling, 25+, total
BAR.SCHL.25UP.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 25+, total is the average years of education completed among people over age 25.

SP.POP.AG10.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10, total refers to the total population at the specified age.

SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.FE.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in general programmes at public and private secondary education institutions.

SP.POP.AG25.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 25, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

SP.POP.1215.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 12-15, female is the total number of females age 12-15.

UIS.GER.123.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Total is the total enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.
