BAR.NOED.7074.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with no education
BAR.NOED.7074.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with no education

MYS.POP.3539.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.3539.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 35-39, female, primary
MYS.POP.3539.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 35-39, female, primary is the total number of females age 35-39 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.3539.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.3539.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 35-39, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.3539.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 35-39, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 35-39.

UIS.E.2.GPV.PU.name: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. General programmes. Total
UIS.E.2.GPV.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. General programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in general programmes at public lower secondary education institutions.

MYS.POP.1564.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1564.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 15-64, female, no education
MYS.POP.1564.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-64, female, no education is the total number of females age 15-64 (in thousands) with no education.

SE.TER.GRAD.HL.ZS.name: Graduates in health (% of total graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.HL.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary graduates in health and welfare is the share of all tertiary graduates who studied health and welfare.

LO.PISA.MAT.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.MAT.name: PISA:Mean performance on the mathematics scale
LO.PISA.MAT.sourceNote: PISA: Mean performance on the mathematics scale is the average score of 15-year-old students on the mathematics scale.

LO.PISA.REA.MA.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.REA.MA.name: PISA:Mean performance on the reading scale, male
LO.PISA.REA.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Mean performance on the reading scale, male is the average score of 15-year-old male students on combined reading literacy scale.

SP.POP.1117.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 11-17, female
SP.POP.1117.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 11-17, female is the total number of females age 11-17.

UIS.REPP.1.G3.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Total
UIS.REPP.1.G3.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.ROFST.1.M.name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Male
UIS.ROFST.1.M.sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Male is the number of males of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

SP.POP.1317.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 13-17, male
SP.POP.1317.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 13-17, male is the total number of males age 13-17.

UIS.LP.AG65.name: Elderly illiterate population. Total
UIS.LP.AG65.sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. Total is the total number of adults over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

MYS.PROP.4044.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4044.NED.FE.name: proportion, 40-44, female, no education
MYS.PROP.4044.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 40-44, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 40-44 with no education.

SE.TOT.ENRR.name: Gross enrolment ratio.  All levels combined (except pre-primary).  Total
SE.TOT.ENRR.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. All levels combined (except pre-primary). Total is the total enrollment in primary, secondary and tertiary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of primary school age, secondary school age, and the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

UIS.NIR.1.AGP1.M.name: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Male
UIS.NIR.1.AGP1.M.sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Male is the number of new male entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of the primary school entrance age.

SP.POP.0711.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 7-11, total
SP.POP.0711.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 7-11, total is the total population age 7-11.

MYS.POP.5559.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.TER.MF.name: population in thousand, 55-59, total, tertiary
MYS.POP.5559.TER.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, total, tertiary is the total number of people age 55-59 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q3.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q3.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 3
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q3.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 3 is the percentage of quintile 3 out-of-school primary-school-age children who have never attended school and are not likely to enter school in the future. Since no survey can say definitively that a school-age person will never attend school, this is a probabilistic indicator. The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q2.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q2.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 2
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q2.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 2 is the percentage of quintile 2 out-of-school primary-school-age children who have never attended school and are not likely to enter school in the future. Since no survey can say definitively that a school-age person will never attend school, this is a probabilistic indicator. The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q1.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 1
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q1.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 1 is the percentage of quintile 1 out-of-school primary-school-age children who have never attended school and are not likely to enter school in the future. Since no survey can say definitively that a school-age person will never attend school, this is a probabilistic indicator. The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

The indicator is based on UNESCO’s methodology, which estimates the proportion of children who will never attend school as the proportion of out of school for the age group with the lowest proportion of out-of-school children. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q4.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. Quintile 4
HH.MICS.OOST.X.Q4.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Never in school. This methodology assumes no dropout before the age at which enrolment rates peak, and no late entry after the age with peak enrolment.

BAR.NOED.4044.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.NOED.4044.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 40-44 with no education
BAR.NOED.4044.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 40-44 with no education

SP.POP.1524.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 15-24, total
SP.POP.1524.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 15-24, total is the total population age 15-24.

SE.PRE.ENRL.FE.ZS.name: Percentage of female students.  Pre-primary
SE.PRE.ENRL.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Pre-primary is the number of female students at the pre-primary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the pre-primary level in a given school year.

UIS.NIRA.1.name: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Total
UIS.NIRA.1.sourceNote: Adjusted net intake rate (%). Primary. Total is the total enrolment in primary education of the official primary school entrance age, as a percentage of the population of the same age in a given school year. It is the equivalent of the age-specific enrolment rate of the official primary entrance age.

UIS.SLEN.12.T.name: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Total
UIS.SLEN.12.T.sourceNote: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Total is the number of years of schooling that a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, excluding years spent repeating grades. The indicator reflects the overall level of development of an education system in terms of the average number of years of schooling without repetition that can be offered to the school-age population, including those who never enter school. It is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the given level of education, plus the number of pupils of unknown age in the given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level of education, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education, minus the number of repeaters in a given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level, multiplied by the duration of that level of education.

SP.POP.0610.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 6-10, female
SP.POP.0610.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 6-10, female is the total number of females age 6-10.

UIS.E.56.F800.name: Enrolment in services. Tertiary. Total
UIS.E.56.F800.sourceNote: Enrolment in services. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary services programs.

BAR.TER.SCHL.4549.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.SCHL.4549.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 45-49, total
BAR.TER.SCHL.4549.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 45-49, total is the average years of tertiary education completed among people age 45-49.

UIS.E.3.GPV.PU.name: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. General programmes. Total
UIS.E.3.GPV.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. General programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in general programmes at public upper secondary education institutions.

SP.POP.AG09.FE.UN.name: Population, aged  9, female
SP.POP.AG09.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 9, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

SP.POP.AG21.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 21, total
SP.POP.AG21.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 21, total refers to the total population at the specified age.

SE.PRM.NINT.FE.ZS.name: Net intake rate in grade 1, female (% of official school-age population)
SE.PRM.NINT.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Female is the number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the same age.

MYS.PROP.1544.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)

MYS.PROP.1544.TER.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-44, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population age 15-44 with tertiary education.

MYS.PROP.1544.TER.MF.name: proportion, 15-44, total, tertiary

NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.KD.sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.
NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.KD.name: GDP per capita, PPP (constant 2011 international $)
NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.KD.sourceNote: GDP per capita based on purchasing power parity (PPP). PPP GDP is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GDP as the U.S. dollar has in the United States. GDP at purchaser's prices is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in constant 2011 international dollars.

SE.ENR.PRSC.FM.ZS.sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.
SE.ENR.PRSC.FM.ZS.name: Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education (%)
SE.ENR.PRSC.FM.ZS.sourceNote: Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.

UIS.XGDP.1.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Primary
UIS.XGDP.1.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Primary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on primary education expressed as a % of GDP.

UIS.GGR.5.A.GPI.name: Gender parity index for gross graduation ratio. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree
UIS.GGR.5.A.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross completion ratio. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree is the ratio of female gross completion rate. Tertiary (ISCED 5A) first degree to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.7074.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.7074.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 70-74, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.7074.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 70-74, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 70-74.

SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS.sourceOrganization: The United Nations Population Division's World Population Prospects.
SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS.name: Population ages 15-64 (% of total)
SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS.sourceNote: Total population between the ages 15 to 64 is the number of people who could potentially be economically active. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship--except for refugees not permanently settled in the country of asylum, who are generally considered part of the population of the country of origin.

UIS.AFR.PBR.1.G2.PU.MATH.name: Africa Dataset: Pupil/textbook ratio. Mathematics. Primary. Grade 2. Public
UIS.AFR.PBR.1.G2.PU.MATH.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.5559.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 55-59, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population age 55-59 with tertiary education.

MYS.PROP.5559.TER.MA.name: proportion, 55-59, male, tertiary

SL.TLF.SECO.FE.ZS.name: Labor force with secondary education, female (% of female labor force)
SL.TLF.SECO.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Labor force with secondary education is the proportion of the labor force that has a secondary education, as a percentage of the total labor force.

SE.XPD.TOTL.GN.ZS.sourceNote: Public expenditure on education as % of GNI is the total public expenditure on education (current and capital) expressed as a percentage of the Gross National Income (GNI) in a given financial year. GNI is also referred to as Gross National Product (GNP). Public expenditure on education includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration and subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).

SP.POP.AG14.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 14, male
SP.POP.AG14.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 14, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

UIS.REPP.1.G4.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Total
UIS.REPP.1.G4.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

MYS.POP.5054.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 50-54, male, no education is the total number of males age 50-54 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.REPR.1.G2.F.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 2. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.REPR.1.G4.F.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 4. Female
UIS.REPR.1.G4.F.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 4. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.OAPP.1.M.sourceNote: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Male is the percentage of the male primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is over the official primary school age.

UIS.R.1.G5.F.name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 5.  Female
UIS.R.1.G5.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 5. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

UIS.E.56.F700.sourceNote: Enrolment in health and welfare. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary health and welfare programs.

SE.SEC.ENRR.LO.MA.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes. Male is the total male enrollment in lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of official lower secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.G4.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNNONS.name: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNNONS.sourceNote: Educational expenditure on other current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on other current education expenditures (excluding salaries) expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current expenditures add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Other Current Expenditures."
