UIS.AFR.PBR.1.PU.MATH.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.DR.1.G4.M.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 4. Male
UIS.DR.1.G4.M.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 4. Male is the proportion of male pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.name: Secondary education, general pupils
SE.SEC.ENRL.GC.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in general programmes at public and private secondary education institutions.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.1519.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.1519.name: average years of secondary schooling, 15-19, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.1519.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 15-19, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 15-19.

UIS.DR.1.G6.F.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 6. Female
UIS.DR.1.G6.F.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 6. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNCUR.name: Educational expenditure on total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNCUR.sourceNote: Educational expenditure on total current expenditures as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on total current education expenditures expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current expenditures add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Total Current Expenditures."

SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.name: Secondary education, teachers, female
SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.sourceNote: Teaching staff in total secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private secondary education institutions (ISCED 2 and 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

BAR.NOED.2529.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.NOED.2529.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 25-29 with no education
BAR.NOED.2529.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 25-29 with no education

UIS.AFR.TATTRR.2.Pu.M.name: Africa Dataset: Teacher attrition rate. Lower secondary. Public. Male
UIS.AFR.TATTRR.2.Pu.M.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 15-64, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 15-64 with secondary education.

BAR.SCHL.4044.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.4044.name: average years of total schooling, 40-44, total
BAR.SCHL.4044.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 40-44, total is the average years of education completed among people age 40-44.

UIS.PRP.3.GPV.name: Percentage of private enrolment.  Upper secondary. General programmes
UIS.PRP.3.GPV.sourceNote: Percentage of private enrolment. Upper secondary. General programmes is the enrolment in private upper secondary general programmes expressed as a percentage of total enrolment (public and private) in upper secondary general programmes. 'Private' refers to all educational institutions not operated by a public authority, regardless of whether they receive financial support from public authorities. A high percentage indicates strong involvement of the non-governmental sector (including religious bodies, other organizations, associations, communities, private enterprises or persons) in providing organized educational programmes.

UIS.E.2.F.name: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public and private. All programmes. Female
UIS.E.2.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public and private. All programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in public and private lower secondary education institutions.

MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 50-54, total, primary
MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 50-54, total, primary is the proportion of the population age 50-54 with primary education.

MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MA.name: proportion, 45-49, male, no education
MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 45-49 with no education.

UIS.T.4.F.name: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female
UIS.T.4.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private post-secondary education institutions (ISCED 4). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MF.name: proportion, 45-49, total, no education
MYS.PROP.4549.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 45-49 with no education.

MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 50-54, male, primary
MYS.PROP.5054.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 50-54, male, primary is the proportion of the male population age 50-54 with primary education.

BAR.TER.ICMP.5054.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.ICMP.5054.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 50-54 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)
BAR.TER.ICMP.5054.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 50-54 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)

BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.FE.name: average years of secondary schooling, 70-74, female
BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.FE.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 70-74, female is the average years of secondary education completed among females age 70-74.

SE.SEC.ENRL.FE.name: Student enrollment, secondary, female
SE.SEC.ENRL.FE.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public and private. All programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private secondary education institutions.

UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.M.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of newly recruited teachers. Lower secondary. Public. Male
UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.M.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.F.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of newly recruited teachers. Lower secondary. Public. Female
UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.F.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

HH.DHS.GAR.456.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.GAR.456.name: DHS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary
HH.DHS.GAR.456.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary is the number of post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of youth of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

SP.POP.1419.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 14-19, total
SP.POP.1419.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 14-19, total is the total population age 14-19.

MYS.POP.5559.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 55-59, female, primary
MYS.POP.5559.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, female, primary is the total number of females age 55-59 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.T.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of newly recruited teachers. Lower secondary. Public. Total
UIS.AFR.NTP.2.PU.T.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.E.23.AgI23.F.name: Pupils of the official school age.  Secondary.  Female
UIS.E.23.AgI23.F.sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Secondary. Female is the total number of female secondary school students who are of the official secondary school age (ISCED 2 & 3). NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WTOIL.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of schools with toilets. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WTOIL.sourceNote: Share of primary schools with a pit latrine, an improved pit latrine, a flush toilet, a pour-flush toilet or a composting toilet. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

XGDP.56.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Tertiary
XGDP.56.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Tertiary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.

UIS.REPP.2.GPV.name: Percentage of repeaters in lower secondary. All grades. Total
UIS.REPP.2.GPV.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in lower secondary. All grades. Total is the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in lower secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of repeaters in all grades of lower secondary education by the total enrolment of lower secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 25-29.

SE.TER.ENRR.MA.name: School enrollment, tertiary, male (% gross)
SE.TER.ENRR.MA.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Tertiary (ISCED 5 and 6). Male is the total male enrollment in tertiary education (ISCED 5 and 6), regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of the five-year age group following on from secondary school leaving.

UIS.XNATURCP.1.FDPUB.FNTS.name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. Teachers salaries
UIS.XNATURCP.1.FDPUB.FNTS.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure by purpose in primary education. Teachers salaries is the percentage of public current expenditures on primary education devoted to teachers salaries.

BAR.POP.6569.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.6569.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 65-69, total
BAR.POP.6569.sourceNote: Population in thousands,65-69, total is the total population of 65-69 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

MYS.POP.80UP.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.80UP.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 80+, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.80UP.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 80+, female, tertiary is the total number of females over age 80 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.E.23.V.PU.name: Enrolment in total secondary. Public. Technical/vocational programmes. Total
UIS.E.23.V.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in technical/vocational programmes in public secondary education institutions.

MYS.POP.25UP.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.25UP.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 25+, female, no education
MYS.POP.25UP.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25+, female, no education is the total number of females over age 25 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.4564.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.4564.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 45-64, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.4564.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 45-64, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 45-64.

MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 70-74, total, secondary
MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 70-74, total, secondary is the total number of people age 70-74 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 70-74, male, secondary
MYS.POP.7074.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 70-74, male, secondary is the total number of males age 70-74 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SE.ADT.1524.LT.FE.ZS.name: Literacy rate, youth female (% of females ages 15-24)
SE.ADT.1524.LT.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Youth (15-24) literacy rate (%). Female is the number of females age 15 to 24 years who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life, divided by the female population in that age group. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations.

UIS.EGGR.1.F.name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Female
UIS.EGGR.1.F.sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Female is the total number of new female entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the female population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

UIS.T.3.V.name: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Total
UIS.T.3.V.sourceNote: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

LO.LLECE.SCI6.FE.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.SCI6.FE.name: LLECE:Mean performance on the science scale for 6th grade students, female
LO.LLECE.SCI6.FE.sourceNote: Mean performance on the science scale for 6th grade students, female

UIS.E.56.F800.F.name: Enrolment in services. Tertiary.  Female
UIS.E.56.F800.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in services. Tertiary. Female is the total number of females enrolled in tertiary services programs.

UIS.EGGR.1.M.name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Male
UIS.EGGR.1.M.sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Male is the total number of new male entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the male population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

UIS.XSPENDP.56.FDPUB.FNS.name: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary.
UIS.XSPENDP.56.FDPUB.FNS.sourceNote: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. is spending on education salaries expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for tertiary education (ISCED 5 & 6). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. Tertiary. Salaries."

SE.PRE.ENRL.FE.name: Enrolment in pre-primary. Public and private. All programmes. Female
SE.PRE.ENRL.FE.sourceNote: Enrolment in pre-primary. Public and private. All programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in public and private pre-primary education institutions.

UIS.NE.1.ECD.F.name: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Female
UIS.NE.1.ECD.F.sourceNote: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Primary. Female is the total number of new female entrants to primary education who have attended an early childhood care and education (ECCE) program.

BAR.POP.5559.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.5559.FE.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 55-59, female
BAR.POP.5559.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousands,55-59, female is the female population of 55-59 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MA.name: proportion, 30 - 34, male, tertiary
MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 30-34, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population age 30-34 with tertiary education.

MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MF.name: proportion, 30 - 34, total, tertiary
MYS.PROP.3034.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 30-34, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population age 30-34 with tertiary education.

UIS.G.56.F600.dcount.F.name: Graduates in agriculture. Tertiary. Female
UIS.G.56.F600.dcount.F.sourceNote: Graduates in agriculture. Tertiary. Female is the total number of female tertiary graduates from agriculture programs.

BAR.SCHL.1519.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.1519.FE.name: average years of total schooling, 15-19, female
BAR.SCHL.1519.FE.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 15-19, female is the average years of education completed among females age 15-19.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.15UP.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.15UP.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 15+ with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.15UP.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 15+ with primary schooling. Completed Primary

UIS.E.1.AgI1.F.name: Pupils of the official school age.  Primary.  Female
UIS.E.1.AgI1.F.sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Primary. Female is the total number of female primary school students who are of the official primary school age. NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MF.name: proportion, 65+, total, no education
MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 65+, total, no education is the proportion of the population over age 65 with no education.

MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 55-59, male, primary
MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 55-59, male, primary is the proportion of the male population age 55-59 with primary education.

MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 55-59, total, primary
MYS.PROP.5559.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 55-59, total, primary is the proportion of the population age 55-59 with primary education.

MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MA.name: proportion, 65+, male, no education
MYS.PROP.65UP.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 65+, male, no education is the proportion of the male population over age 65 with no education.

UIS.E.1.AgI1.M.name: Pupils of the official school age.  Primary.  Male
UIS.E.1.AgI1.M.sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Primary. Male is the total number of male primary school students who are of the official primary school age. NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.NE.1.G1.F.name: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education.  Female
UIS.NE.1.G1.F.sourceNote: New entrants to Grade 1 of primary education. Female is the number of female pupils entering primary education for the first time.

SE.PRM.GINT.FE.ZS.name: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education, female (% of relevant age group)
SE.PRM.GINT.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.

BAR.SCHL.5559.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.5559.name: average years of total schooling, 55-59, total
BAR.SCHL.5559.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 55-59, total is the average years of education completed among people age 55-59.

BAR.NOED.5559.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.NOED.5559.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 55-59 with no education
BAR.NOED.5559.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 55-59 with no education

SE.ENR.PRIM.FM.ZS.sourceOrganization: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.
SE.ENR.PRIM.FM.ZS.name: Ratio of female to male primary enrollment (%)
SE.ENR.PRIM.FM.ZS.sourceNote: Ratio of female to male primary enrollment is the percentage of girls to boys enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.

HH.DHS.PCR.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.Q1.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Quintile 1
HH.DHS.PCR.Q1.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Quintile 1 is the total number of quintile 1 students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of quintile 1 repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of quintile 1 children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

HH.DHS.PCR.Q2.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.Q2.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Quintile 2
HH.DHS.PCR.Q2.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Quintile 2 is the total number of quintile 2 students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of quintile 2 repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of quintile 2 children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

MYS.POP.6064.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.6064.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 60-64, total, secondary
MYS.POP.6064.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 60-64, total, secondary is the total number of people age 60-64 (in thousands) with secondary education.

HH.DHS.PCR.Q4.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.Q4.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Quintile 4
HH.DHS.PCR.Q4.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Quintile 4 is the total number of quintile 4 students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of quintile 4 repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of quintile 4 children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

HH.DHS.PCR.Q5.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.Q5.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Quintile 5
HH.DHS.PCR.Q5.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Quintile 5 is the total number of quintile 5 students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of quintile 5 repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of quintile 5 children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

BAR.TER.SCHL.6569.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.SCHL.6569.FE.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 65-69, female
BAR.TER.SCHL.6569.FE.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 65-69, female is the average years of tertiary education completed among females age 65-69.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.5559.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.5559.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 55-59 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.5559.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 55-59 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

UIS.FEP.4.name: Percentage of female students.  Post-secondary non-tertiary education
UIS.FEP.4.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Post-secondary non-tertiary education is the number of female students at the post-secondary non-tertiary education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the post-secondary non-tertiary education level in a given school year.

UIS.FEP.6.name: Percentage of female students.  Tertiary ISCED 6
UIS.FEP.6.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Tertiary ISCED 6 is the number of female students at the tertiary (ISCED 6) education level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the tertiary (ISCED 6) education level in a given school year.

LO.PIRLS.REA.BL.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)'s Progress in International Reading Literacy Study (PIRLS)
LO.PIRLS.REA.BL.name: PIRLS: Fourth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark in reading achievement (%)
LO.PIRLS.REA.BL.sourceNote: Fourth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark in reading achievement (%) is the share of fourth grade students who did not score at least 400 on the reading assessment. These figures were calculated by the World Bank EdStats team by subtracting the share of students reaching the low international benchmark from 100. For further information on benchmarking levels, please visit the PIRLS website.

SE.PRE.ENRL.TC.ZS.name: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Pre-primary
SE.PRE.ENRL.TC.ZS.sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Pre-primary is the number of pupils enrolled in pre-primary divided by the number of pre-primary school teachers.

MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MA.name: proportion, 20 - 24, male, no education
MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 20-24, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 20-24 with no education.

MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MF.name: proportion, 25 - 29, total, no education
MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 25-29 with no education.

MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MA.name: proportion, 25 - 29, male, no education
MYS.PROP.2529.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 25-29 with no education.

MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MF.name: proportion, 20 - 24, total, no education
MYS.PROP.2024.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 20-24, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 20-24 with no education.

UIS.FOSEP.56.FUK.name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in unspecified and general programmes
UIS.FOSEP.56.FUK.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in unspecified and general programmes is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in unspecified and general programmes.

SP.POP.AG16.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 16, female
SP.POP.AG16.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 16, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

HH.MICS.NAR.23.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.23.R.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Rural
HH.MICS.NAR.23.R.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Rural is the proportion of rural children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

SE.PRM.ENRL.FE.ZS.name: Primary education, pupils (% female)
SE.PRM.ENRL.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female students. Primary is the number of female students at the primary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of students (male and female) at the primary level in a given school year.

UIS.LP.AG65.M.name: Elderly illiterate population. Male
UIS.LP.AG65.M.sourceNote: Elderly illiterate population. Male is the total number of males over age 65 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

HH.MICS.NAR.23.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.23.U.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Urban
HH.MICS.NAR.23.U.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Urban is the proportion of urban children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

UIS.ECDP.1.F.name: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience.  Female
UIS.ECDP.1.F.sourceNote: Percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience. Female is the number of new female entrants to primary grade 1 who have attended some form of organized early childhood care and education (ECCE) program for the equivalent of at least 200 hours, expressed as a percentage of total number of new female entrants to primary grade 1.

MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 15-19, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-19, total, secondary is the proportion of the population age 15-19 with secondary education.

UIS.NE.1.ECD.name: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Total
UIS.NE.1.ECD.sourceNote: New entrants who have attended some ECCE programme. Primary. Total is the total number of new entrants to primary education who have attended an early childhood care and education (ECCE) program.

HH.MICS.NAR.23.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.23.M.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Male
HH.MICS.NAR.23.M.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Male is the proportion of male children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 15-19, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.1519.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-19, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 15-19 with secondary education.

HH.MICS.NAR.23.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.23.F.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Female
HH.MICS.NAR.23.F.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Female is the proportion of female children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

LO.SACMEQ.REA.FE.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.REA.FE.name: SACMEQ:Mean performance on the reading scale, female
LO.SACMEQ.REA.FE.sourceNote: SACMEQ: Mean performance on the reading scale, female is the mean reading score for female 6th grade students. Mean scores are on SACMEQ scales for reading, which have averages of 500 and standard deviations of 100.

UIS.AFR.GTCTR.3.M.name: Africa Dataset: Ratio of teacher training graduates to teachers in service. Upper secondary. Public and private. Male
UIS.AFR.GTCTR.3.M.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

BAR.TER.CMPT.2529.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.CMPT.2529.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 25-29 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary
BAR.TER.CMPT.2529.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 25-29 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 45-49, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 45-49 with secondary education.

MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 45-49, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.4549.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, total, secondary is the proportion of the population age 45-49 with secondary education.

UIS.T.23.GPV.F.name: Teaching staff in total secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female
UIS.T.23.GPV.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in total secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in general programmes in public and private secondary education institutions (ISCED 2 and 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G2.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 2. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

SE.XPD.CUR.SECO.ZS.name: Public current education expenditure, secondary (% of current education expenditure)
SE.XPD.CUR.SECO.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to secondary education.

MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 40-44, total, secondary
MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 40-44, total, secondary is the total number of people age 40-44 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 40-44, male, secondary
MYS.POP.4044.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 40-44, male, secondary is the total number of males age 40-44 (in thousands) with secondary education.

UIS.E.0.Pu.name: Enrolment in pre-primary. Public. All programmes. Total
UIS.E.0.Pu.sourceNote: Enrolment in pre-primary. Public. All programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in public pre-primary education institutions.

UIS.E.1.G2.F.name: Enrolment in primary. Grade 2.  Female
UIS.E.1.G2.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in primary. Grade 2. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in Grade 2 of primary education.

BAR.TER.SCHL.5559.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.SCHL.5559.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 55-59, total
BAR.TER.SCHL.5559.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 55-59, total is the average years of tertiary education completed among people age 55-59.

UIS.XGDP.FSint.FDinst.FFd.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. International sources. All levels
UIS.XGDP.FSint.FDinst.FFd.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. International sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from international sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.

UIS.CEAge.1.name: Starting age of compulsory education
UIS.CEAge.1.sourceNote: Starting age of compulsory education is the official age when students should enter compulsory education.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.name: average years of secondary schooling, 35-39, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 35-39, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 35-39.

UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNS.name: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4.
UIS.XSPENDP.1234.FDPUB.FNS.sourceNote: Educational expenditure on salaries as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. is spending on education salaries expressed as a percentage of the total expenditure for primary, lower/upper secondary, and post-secondary/non-tertiary education (ISCED 1,2,3, and 4). Salaries and other current add up to the total current expenditure. Public subsidies to the private sector and administrative costs should be excluded. This in indicator is also referred to as "Educational expenditure by nature of spending as a % of total educational expenditure on public institutions. ISCED 1,2,3,4. Salaries."

BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

MYS.PROP.15UP.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.15UP.NED.MF.name: proportion, 15+, total, no education
MYS.PROP.15UP.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15+, total, no education is the proportion of the population over age 15 with no education.

MYS.POP.2529.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.2529.TER.MA.name: population in thousand, 25 - 29, male, tertiary
MYS.POP.2529.TER.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25-29, male, tertiary is the total number of males age 25-29 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

MYS.POP.2529.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.2529.TER.MF.name: population in thousand, 25 - 29, total, tertiary
MYS.POP.2529.TER.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25-29, total, tertiary is the total number of people age 25-29 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.thAge.0.name: Entrance age of pre-primary
UIS.thAge.0.sourceNote: Entrance age of pre-primary is the age at which students would enter pre-primary education.

SE.PRM.DROP.FE.ZS.name: Drop-out rate (%), primary, female
SE.PRM.DROP.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Female is calculated by subtracting the female survival rate from 100.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G5.name: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.R.23.GPV.G5.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Total is the number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

SE.PRE.ENRR.FE.name: School enrollment, preprimary, female (% gross)
SE.PRE.ENRR.FE.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Pre-primary. Female is the total female enrollment in pre-primary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of official pre-primary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

BAR.POP.2024.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.2024.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 20-24, total
BAR.POP.2024.sourceNote: Population in thousands, 20-24, total is the total population of 20-24 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

SE.PRM.NENR.FE.name: School enrollment, primary, female (% net)
SE.PRM.NENR.FE.sourceNote: Net enrolment rate. Primary. Female is the ratio of female children of the official primary school age who are enrolled in primary school to the female population of the official primary school age.

SE.TER.GRAD.FE.name: Graduates, tertiary, female
SE.TER.GRAD.FE.sourceNote: Total graduates in all programmes. Tertiary. Female is the total number of female graduates from all programmes at ISCED 5 and 6 tertiary institutions.

SP.POP.AG24.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 24, female
SP.POP.AG24.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 24, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

MYS.POP.6569.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.6569.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 65-69, female, primary
MYS.POP.6569.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65-69, female, primary is the total number of females age 65-69 (in thousands) with primary education.

SE.TER.GRAD.FE.ZS.name: Girls graduates share (%), tertiary
SE.TER.GRAD.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female graduates in tertiary education (ISCED 5 and 6) is the number of females graduating from ISCED 5 and 6 expressed as a percentage of the total number of ISCED 5 and 6 tertiary graduates (male and female).

SP.PRE.TOTL.FE.IN.name: Population, pre-primary, female
SP.PRE.TOTL.FE.IN.sourceNote: School age population. Pre-primary. Female is the female population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to pre-primary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.MA.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.MA.name: PASEC: 5th grade students above the Knowledge Base Rate on the mathematics scale (above 40% of answers correct) (%), male
LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.MA.sourceNote: Indicator is the share of male students who score above the Knowledge Base Rate, which is the proportion of pupils who achieve a minimum learning goal, based on the programs of the level selected, appropriate to the scale of the tests used.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 60-64, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 60-64, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 60-64.

SP.POP.0305.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 3- 5, female
SP.POP.0305.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 3-5, female is the total number of females age 3-5.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 60-64, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6064.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 60-64, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 60-64.

BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 60-64 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary
BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 60-64 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary

UIS.GER.123.M.name: Gross enrolment ratio.  Primary & Secondary combined.  Male
UIS.GER.123.M.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Male is the total male enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total male population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

UIS.E.4.PU.name: Enrolment in post-secondary non tertiary. Public. All programmes. Total
UIS.E.4.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in post-secondary non tertiary. Public. All programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in public post-secondary/non-tertiary education institutions.

SE.XPD.TOTL.GB.ZS.name: Public spending on education, total (% of government expenditure)
SE.XPD.TOTL.GB.ZS.sourceNote: Public expenditure on education as % of total government expenditure is the total public education expenditure (current and capital) expressed as a percentage of total government expenditure for all sectors in a given financial year. Public education expenditure includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private), education administration, and subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities).

UIS.GER.123.F.name: Gross enrolment ratio.  Primary & Secondary combined.  Female
UIS.GER.123.F.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Primary & Secondary combined. Female is the total female enrollment in primary and secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total female population of official primary and secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

MYS.POP.25UP.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.25UP.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 25+, female, primary
MYS.POP.25UP.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25+, female, primary is the total number of females over age 25 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.POP.4044.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4044.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 40-44, female, no education
MYS.POP.4044.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 40-44, female, no education is the total number of females age 40-44 (in thousands) with no education.

SE.PRM.EPCR.ZS.name: Expected primary completion rate  (% of population at theoretical entrance age)
SE.PRM.EPCR.ZS.sourceNote: Expected primary completion rate. Total is the total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to reach the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official entrance age to primary education in the same year. It is calculated by multiplying the gross intake ratio to the first grade of primary education by the survival rate to the last grade of primary. This indicator is also known as "Expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary. Total."

SE.SEC.PROG.MA.ZS.name: Progression to secondary school, male (%)
SE.SEC.PROG.MA.ZS.sourceNote: Transition from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2), general programmes (%). Male is the number of new male entrants to the first grade of secondary education (general programmes only) in a given year, expressed as a percentage of the number of male pupils enrolled in the final grade of primary education in the previous year.

UIS.DR.1.G1.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 1. Total
UIS.DR.1.G1.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 1. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

UIS.DR.1.G2.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 2. Total
UIS.DR.1.G2.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 2. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

HH.DHS.TR.12.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.TR.12.U.name: DHS: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Urban
HH.DHS.TR.12.U.sourceNote: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Urban is the proportion of urban pupils in the last grade of primary who transition to the first grade of secondary the following school year.

HH.DHS.TR.12.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.TR.12.R.name: DHS: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Rural
HH.DHS.TR.12.R.sourceNote: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Rural is the proportion of rural pupils in the last grade of primary who transition to the first grade of secondary the following school year.

BAR.SEC.CMPT.75UP.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.CMPT.75UP.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 75+ with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary
BAR.SEC.CMPT.75UP.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 75+ with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary

UIS.DR.1.G6.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 6. Total
UIS.DR.1.G6.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 6. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

UIS.DR.1.G7.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 7. Total
UIS.DR.1.G7.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 7. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.FE.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.FE.name: SACMEQ:Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), female
LO.SACMEQ.REA.LOW.FE.sourceNote: Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), female

BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.FE.name: average years of secondary schooling, 35-39, female
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3539.FE.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 35-39, female is the average years of secondary education completed among females age 35-39.

UIS.T.2.V.name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Total
UIS.T.2.V.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

HH.DHS.TR.12.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.TR.12.F.name: DHS: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Female
HH.DHS.TR.12.F.sourceNote: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Female is the proportion of female pupils in the last grade of primary who transition to the first grade of secondary the following school year.

BAR.TER.CMPT.75UP.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.CMPT.75UP.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 75+ with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary
BAR.TER.CMPT.75UP.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 75+ with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

HH.DHS.TR.12.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.TR.12.M.name: DHS: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Male
HH.DHS.TR.12.M.sourceNote: Transition rate. Primary to Secondary. Male is the proportion of male pupils in the last grade of primary who transition to the first grade of secondary the following school year.

BAR.NOED.1519.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.NOED.1519.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 15-19 with no education
BAR.NOED.1519.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 15-19 with no education

UIS.GGR.2.name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Total
UIS.GGR.2.sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Total is the number of graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

UIS.T.2.F.name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female
UIS.T.2.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.REPP.1.G4.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Male
UIS.REPP.1.G4.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 4. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.1.G6.F.name: Enrolment in primary. Grade 6.  Female
UIS.E.1.G6.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in primary. Grade 6. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in Grade 6 of primary education.

UIS.thAge.4.A.GPV.name: Entrance age of 4A post-secondary
UIS.thAge.4.A.GPV.sourceNote: Entrance age of 4A post-secondary is the age at which students would enter ISCED 4A post-secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.

SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.name: Secondary education, vocational pupils
SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.sourceNote: Enrolment in total secondary. Public and private. Technical/vocational programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled in technical/vocational programmes at public and private secondary education institutions.

UIS.REPP.1.G2.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Female
UIS.REPP.1.G2.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G8.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 8. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G8.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 8. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 8 of secondary education.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G9.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 9. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G9.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 9. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 9 of secondary education.

MYS.POP.4549.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4549.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 45-49, female, secondary
MYS.POP.4549.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-49, female, secondary is the total number of females age 45-49 (in thousands) with secondary education.

BAR.POP.5559.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.5559.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 55-59, total
BAR.POP.5559.sourceNote: Population in thousands,55-59, total is the total population of 55-59 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G2.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 2. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G2.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 2. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 2 of secondary education.

MYS.POP.5559.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 55-59, female, secondary
MYS.POP.5559.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, female, secondary is the total number of females age 55-59 (in thousands) with secondary education.

UIS.REPP.1.G2.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Male
UIS.REPP.1.G2.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 2. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G1.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 1. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G1.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 1. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 1 of secondary education.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G6.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 6. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G6.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 6. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 6 of secondary education.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G7.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 7. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G7.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 7. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 7 of secondary education.

MYS.POP.7579.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7579.TER.MA.name: population in thousand, 75-79, male, tertiary
MYS.POP.7579.TER.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 75-79, male, tertiary is the total number of males age 75-79 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.E.23.GPV.G5.name: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.E.23.GPV.G5.sourceNote: Enrolment in secondary. Grade 5. Total is the total number of students enrolled in Grade 5 of secondary education.

MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 65+, male, primary
MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 65+, male, primary is the proportion of the male population over age 65 with primary education.

MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 65+, total, primary
MYS.PROP.65UP.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 65+, total, primary is the proportion of the population over age 65 with primary education.

UIS.FEP.56.FOREIGN.name: International (or internationally mobile) students. Tertiary. % Female
UIS.FEP.56.FOREIGN.sourceNote: International (or internationally mobile) students. Tertiary. % Female is the female share of students who have crossed a national or territorial border for the purposes of education and are now enrolled outside their country of origin.

SE.PRM.CMPT.FE.ZS.name: Primary completion rate, female (% of relevant age group)
SE.PRM.CMPT.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Primary completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education. It is calculated by taking the total number of students in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the total number of children of official graduation age.

SP.PRM.GRAD.MA.name: School age population. Primary. Last Grade. Male
SP.PRM.GRAD.MA.sourceNote: School age population. Primary. Last Grade. Male is the male population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to the last grade of primary school as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WOELEC.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of schools without electricity. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WOELEC.sourceNote: Share of primary schools with no access to permanent sources of electrical power (i.e. grid/mains connection, wind, water, solar, permanently fuel-powered generator, etc.). Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.G7.PU.name: Africa Dataset: Average class size. Single grade classes. Grade 7. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.G7.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

SE.TER.GRAD.SC.ZS.name: Graduates in science (% of total graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.SC.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary graduates in science is the share of all tertiary graduates who studied science.

LO.LLECE.REA6.FE.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.REA6.FE.name: LLECE:Mean performance on the reading scale for 6th grade students, female

UIS.T.2.GPV.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in general programmes in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.PU.name: Africa Dataset: Average class size. Single grade classes. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

LO.PISA.SCI.FE.sourceNote: PISA: Mean performance on the science scale, female is the average score of 15-year-old female students on science literacy scale.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.4549.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.4549.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 45-49, female

SE.SCH.LIFE.name: Expected years of schooling
SE.SCH.LIFE.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to tertiary. Total is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.3034.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3034.name: average years of secondary schooling, 30-34, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.3034.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 30-34, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 30-34.

BAR.SEC.CMPT.3539.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.CMPT.3539.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary
BAR.SEC.CMPT.3539.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary

UIS.E.3.GPV.F.name: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Female
UIS.E.3.GPV.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in general programmes at public and private upper secondary education institutions.

HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q4.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q4.name: DHS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 4
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q4.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 4 is the proportion of quintile 4 children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q5.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q5.name: DHS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 5
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q5.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 5 is the proportion of quintile 5 children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q1.name: DHS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 1
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q1.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 1 is the proportion of quintile 1 children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q3.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q3.name: DHS: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 3
HH.DHS.NAR.23.Q3.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary. Quintile 3 is the proportion of quintile 3 children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.
