BAR.PRM.CMPT.2024.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 20-24 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.2024.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 20-24 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

SE.TER.GRAD.SC.FE.ZS.name: Graduates in science, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.SC.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary graduates in science is the share of all female tertiary graduates who studied science.

UIS.ROFST.1.F.name: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Female
UIS.ROFST.1.F.sourceNote: Out-of-school rate for children of primary school age (%). Female is the number of females of official primary school age who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school, expressed as a percentage of the female population of official primary school age. Children enrolled in pre-primary education are excluded and considered out of school.

SE.TER.GRAD.HL.FE.ZS.name: Graduates in health, female (% of total female graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.HL.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary graduates in health and welfare is the share of all female tertiary graduates who studied health and welfare.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 40-44 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.4044.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 40-44 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

MYS.POP.5559.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.5559.TER.MA.name: population in thousand, 55-59, male, tertiary
MYS.POP.5559.TER.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 55-59, male, tertiary is the total number of males age 55-59 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.E.2.PU.name: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. All programmes. Total
UIS.E.2.PU.sourceNote: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public. All programmes. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public lower secondary education institutions.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.2529.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.2529.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 25-29 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.2529.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 25-29 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

SP.PRE.TOTL.IN.name: Population, pre-primary, total
SP.PRE.TOTL.IN.sourceNote: School age population. Pre-primary. Total is the population of the age-group theoretically corresponding to pre-primary education as indicated by theoretical entrance age and duration.

HH.DHS.GAR.456.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.GAR.456.U.name: DHS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Urban
HH.DHS.GAR.456.U.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Urban is the number of urban post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the urban population of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.GGR.2.M.name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Male
UIS.GGR.2.M.sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Male is the number of male graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the male population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

LO.PISA.MAT.MA.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.MAT.MA.name: PISA:Mean performance on the mathematics scale, male
LO.PISA.MAT.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Mean performance on the mathematics scale, male is the average score of 15-year-old male students on the mathematics scale.

BAR.SCHL.4044.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.4044.FE.name: average years of total schooling, 40-44, female
BAR.SCHL.4044.FE.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 40-44, female is the average years of education completed among females age 40-44.

HH.DHS.GAR.456.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.GAR.456.R.name: DHS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Rural
HH.DHS.GAR.456.R.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Rural is the number of rural post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the rural population of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.GGR.2.F.name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Female
UIS.GGR.2.F.sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. All programmes. Female is the number of female graduates regardless of age in all lower secondary education programmes expressed as a percentage of the female population at the theoretical graduation age for lower secondary education.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.7074.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.7074.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 70-74, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.7074.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 70-74, female is the average years of primary education completed among females age 70-74.

MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 25 - 29, male, primary
MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, male, primary is the proportion of the male population age 25-29 with primary education.

MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 25 - 29, total, primary
MYS.PROP.2529.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, total, primary is the proportion of the population age 25-29 with primary education.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.6064.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.6064.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 60-64 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.6064.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 60-64 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

MYS.PROP.1564.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.FE.name: proportion, 15-64, female, no education
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 15-64 with no education.

UIS.SLEN.12.F.name: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Female
UIS.SLEN.12.F.sourceNote: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Female is the number of years of schooling that a female child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, excluding years spent repeating grades. The indicator reflects the overall level of development of an education system in terms of the average number of years of schooling without repetition that can be offered to the school-age population, including those who never enter school. It is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the given level of education, plus the number of pupils of unknown age in the given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level of education, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education, minus the number of repeaters in a given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level, multiplied by the duration of that level of education.

HH.DHS.GAR.456.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.GAR.456.F.name: DHS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Female
HH.DHS.GAR.456.F.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Female is the number of female post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the population of females of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

HH.MICS.PCR.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.PCR.name: MICS: Primary completion rate
HH.MICS.PCR.sourceNote: Primary completion rate is the total number of students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

HH.DHS.GAR.456.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.GAR.456.M.name: DHS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Male
HH.DHS.GAR.456.M.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary. Male is the number of male post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of the population of males of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

UIS.SLEN.12.M.name: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Male
UIS.SLEN.12.M.sourceNote: School life expectancy net of repetition (years). Primary to lower secondary. Male is the number of years of schooling that a male child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, excluding years spent repeating grades. The indicator reflects the overall level of development of an education system in terms of the average number of years of schooling without repetition that can be offered to the school-age population, including those who never enter school. It is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the given level of education, plus the number of pupils of unknown age in the given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level of education, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education, minus the number of repeaters in a given level of education divided by the school-age population for that level, multiplied by the duration of that level of education.

UIS.AFR.CS.MG.1.PU.name: Africa Dataset: Average class size. Multigrade classes. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.CS.MG.1.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.1564.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.TER.FE.name: proportion, 15-64, female, tertiary
MYS.PROP.1564.TER.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, female, tertiary is the proportion of the female population age 15-64 with tertiary education.

MYS.PROP.1544.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1544.PRI.MA.name: proportion, 15-44, male, primary

BAR.TER.CMPT.3539.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

MYS.PROP.1544.PRI.MF.name: proportion, 15-44, total, primary

LO.SACMEQ.REA.HIG.MA.sourceNote: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), male

SE.SEC.ENRR.LO.name: Gross enrollment rate (%), lower secondary, total
SE.SEC.ENRR.LO.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes. Total is the total enrollment in lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official lower secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G4.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 4. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.XGDP.FDINSTADM.FFD.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. All levels
UIS.XGDP.FDINSTADM.FFD.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.

HH.MICS.PCR.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.PCR.F.name: MICS: Primary completion rate. Female
HH.MICS.PCR.F.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Female is the total number of female students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of female repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of female children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

LO.LLECE.MAT6.LOW.FE.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.MAT6.LOW.FE.name: LLECE: 6th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), female

SE.XPD.CUR.TERT.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Tertiary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to tertiary education.

UIS.GER.0.GPI.name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio.  Pre-primary
UIS.GER.0.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Pre-primary is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary to male gross enrolment ratio for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

UIS.TRANR.23.GPV.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for transition rate, primary to secondary, general programmes is the ratio of the female transition rate from primary to secondary (general programmes) to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. SE.PRE.TCHR.FE.ZS.name: Percentage female teachers.  Pre-primary
SE.PRE.TCHR.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Pre-primary is the number of female teachers at the pre-primary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the pre-primary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.GER.2.GPI.name: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio.  Lower secondary.  All programmes
UIS.GER.2.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for gross enrolment ratio. Lower secondary. All programmes is the ratio of female gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes) to the male gross enrolment ratio for lower secondary (All programmes). It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

UIS.SLE.123.name: School life expectancy (years).  Primary to secondary.  Total
UIS.SLE.123.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Total is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

UIS.TRANRA.23.GPV.name: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Total
UIS.TRANRA.23.GPV.sourceNote: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Total shows the real transition from primary to secondary regardless of repetition. This indicator better reflects situations in which pupils repeat the last grade of primary but eventually make the transition to secondary. It is defined for a given year as the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary in the following year expressed as a percentage of the students enrolled in the last grade of primary education in the given year who do not repeat that grade the following year.

BAR.TER.CMPT.3539.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/

BAR.TER.CMPT.3539.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 35-39 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

SE.SEC.REPT.MA.ZS.name: Repeaters, secondary, male (% of male enrollment)
SE.SEC.REPT.MA.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. All grades. Male is the number of male students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all male students enrolled in secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of male repeaters in all grades of secondary education by the total male enrolment of secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

SE.PRM.REPT.MA.ZS.name: Repeaters, primary, male (% of male enrollment)
SE.PRM.REPT.MA.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. All grades. Male is the number of male students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all male students enrolled in primary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of male repeaters in all grades of primary education by the total male enrolment of primary education and multiplying the result by 100.

HH.DHS.OOST.DO.Q4.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out. Quintile 4 is the proportion of quintile 4 out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

UIS.TEP.5.B.name: Distribution of students (%).   ISCED Level 5B
UIS.TEP.5.B.sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 5B is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 5B as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. The content of tertiary ISCED level 5B programmes is practically oriented/occupationally specific and is mainly designed for participants to acquire the practical skills needed for employment in a particular occupation or trade or class of occupations or trades - the successful completion of which usually provides the participants with a labor-market relevant qualification.

UIS.TEP.5.A.name: Distribution of students (%).  ISCED Level 5A
UIS.TEP.5.A.sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 5A is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 5A as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. ISCED level 5A programmes are tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and professions with high skills requirements.

UIS.TRTP.3.name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Upper secondary.  Total
UIS.TRTP.3.sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Upper secondary. Total is the number of teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the upper secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers at the upper secondary level.

HH.DHS.OOS.1.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.OOS.1.F.name: DHS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Female
HH.DHS.OOS.1.F.sourceNote: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Female is the number of female children in the official primary school age range who are not attending primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of female children of the official primary school age range. By definition, children in the official primary-age range, who are attending pre-primary education, are considered out-of-school. The sum of the net primary attendance rate and the proportion out of school do not add to 100 percent because the net primary attendance rate does not count students who are in secondary.

HH.MICS.OOST.L.R.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Late entry. Rural is defined as the proportion of rural out-of-school children who are currently out of school but are expected to enter the education system later than they should. It is calculated based on UNESCO's methodology as the proportion leftover from those estimated as never in school, expressed as a percent of the proportion out-of-school for children younger than the age with the highest attendance rate.

SE.PRE.TCHR.FE.name: Teaching staff in pre-primary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female
SE.PRE.TCHR.FE.sourceNote: Teaching staff in pre-primary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private pre-primary education institutions. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.EGGR.1.name: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Total
UIS.EGGR.1.sourceNote: Expected gross primary graduation ratio. Total is the total number of new entrants to the first grade of primary in a given year, regardless of age, who are expected to graduate from the last grade of primary education, regardless of repetition, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official graduation age from primary education in the same year. This indicator is calculated by multiplying the expected gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education by the probability of graduation at the last grade of primary. This indicator is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method.

MYS.POP.4564.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4564.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 45-64, total, secondary
MYS.POP.4564.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, total, secondary is the total number of people age 45-64 (in thousands) with secondary education.

BAR.POP.2024.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.2024.FE.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 20-24, female
BAR.POP.2024.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousands, 20-24, female is the female population of 20-24 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

MYS.POP.4564.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 45-64, male, secondary
MYS.POP.4564.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, male, secondary is the total number of males age 45-64 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 15-19, male, secondary
MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-19, male, secondary is the total number of males age 15-19 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SP.POP.0713.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 7-13, male
SP.POP.0713.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 7-13, male is the total number of males age 7-13.

MYS.POP.80UP.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.80UP.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 80+, female, no education
MYS.POP.80UP.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 80+, female, no education is the total number of females over age 80 (in thousands) with no education.

HH.DHS.PCR.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.F.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Female
HH.DHS.PCR.F.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Female is the total number of female students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of female repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of female children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 15-19, total, secondary
MYS.POP.1519.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-19, total, secondary is the total number of people age 15-19 (in thousands) with secondary education.

HH.DHS.PCR.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.M.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Male
HH.DHS.PCR.M.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Male is the total number of male students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of male repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of male children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

HH.DHS.PCR.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.R.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Rural
HH.DHS.PCR.R.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Rural is the total number of rural students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of rural repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of rural children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

UIS.AFR.PBR.1.PU.READ.name: Africa Dataset: Pupil/textbook ratio. Reading. Primary. All Grades. Public
UIS.AFR.PBR.1.PU.READ.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.4044.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.4044.FE.name: average years of secondary schooling, 40-44, female
BAR.SEC.SCHL.4044.FE.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 40-44, female is the average years of secondary education completed among females age 40-44.

UIS.SR.1.G5.GPI.name: Gender parity index for survival rate to grade 5
UIS.SR.1.G5.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for survival rate to grade 5 is the ratio of female survival rate to grade 5 to the male survival rate to grade 5. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

HH.DHS.PCR.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.PCR.U.name: DHS: Primary completion rate. Urban
HH.DHS.PCR.U.sourceNote: Primary completion rate. Urban is the total number of urban students of any age in the last grade of primary school, minus the number of urban repeaters in that grade, divided by the number of urban children of official graduation age. The completion rate can exceed 100 percent if there are many overage students in the last grade of primary school.

BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 60-64 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary
BAR.SEC.CMPT.6064.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 60-64 with secondary schooling. Completed Secondary

UIS.T.2.name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
UIS.T.2.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.T.3.name: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
UIS.T.3.sourceNote: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.T.5.A.name: Teaching staff in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
UIS.T.5.A.sourceNote: Teaching staff in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private ISCED 5A tertiary education institutions. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.T.4.name: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total
UIS.T.4.sourceNote: Teaching staff in post-secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private post-secondary education institutions (ISCED 4). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

SE.PRM.TENR.FE.name: Adjusted net enrollment rate, primary, female (% of primary school age children)
SE.PRM.TENR.FE.sourceNote: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.

UIS.XGDP.56.FDINSTADM.FFD.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Tertiary
UIS.XGDP.56.FDINSTADM.FFD.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. All sources. Tertiary is the expenditure coming from public, private and international sources spent on tertiary education expressed as a % of GDP.

UIS.E.56.F300.F.name: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary.  Female
UIS.E.56.F300.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Female is the total number of females enrolled in tertiary social sciences, business and law programs.

SP.POP.1418.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 14-18, total
SP.POP.1418.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 14-18, total is the total population age 14-18.

MYS.POP.7074.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7074.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 70-74, total, no education
MYS.POP.7074.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 70-74, total, no education is the total number of people age 70-74 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.POP.2529.PRI.MF.name: population in thousand, 25 - 29, total, primary
MYS.POP.2529.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25-29, total, primary is the total number of people age 25-29 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.POP.2529.PRI.MA.name: population in thousand, 25 - 29, male, primary
MYS.POP.2529.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25-29, male, primary is the total number of males age 25-29 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.POP.7074.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.7074.NED.MA.name: population in thousand, 70-74, male, no education
MYS.POP.7074.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 70-74, male, no education is the total number of males age 70-74 (in thousands) with no education.

HH.MICS.GAR.456.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.GAR.456.name: MICS: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary
HH.MICS.GAR.456.sourceNote: Gross attendance rate. Post Secondary is the number of post-secondary school pupils of any age, expressed as a percentage of youth of post-secondary school age. Post-secondary school age is defined as the age range from graduation from secondary school till the maximum age set as a parameter of the educational system.

MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MF.name: population in thousand, 15-19, total, primary
MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-19, total, primary is the total number of people age 15-19 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MA.name: population in thousand, 15-19, male, primary
MYS.POP.1519.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-19, male, primary is the total number of males age 15-19 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.TE_100000.56.F.name: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Female
UIS.TE_100000.56.F.sourceNote: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Female is the number of female students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year per 100,000 inhabitants. It is calculated by dividing the total number of female students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year by the country’s population and multiplying the result by 100,000.

NY.GDP.MKTP.CD.sourceOrganization: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.
NY.GDP.MKTP.CD.name: GDP (current US$)
NY.GDP.MKTP.CD.sourceNote: GDP at purchaser's prices is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in current U.S. dollars. Dollar figures for GDP are converted from domestic currencies using single year official exchange rates. For a few countries where the official exchange rate does not reflect the rate effectively applied to actual foreign exchange transactions, an alternative conversion factor is used.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.6569.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6569.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 65-69, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.6569.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 65-69, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 65-69.

UIS.E.56.Fuk2.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in general programmes. Tertiary. Female is the total number of females enrolled in tertiary general programmes.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.name: PASEC: 5th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (less than 25% of answers correct) (%), total
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.sourceNote: Indicator is for Failure Rate on the PASEC exam, which is less than the score a pupil could obtain by completing the PASEC test randomly.

UIS.AFR.FNTP.1.name: Africa Dataset: Newly recruited teachers. % female. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.FNTP.1.sourceNote: Share of newly recruited public primary school teachers who are female. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.AFR.FNTP.2.name: Africa Dataset: Newly recruited teachers. % female. Lower secondary. Public
UIS.AFR.FNTP.2.sourceNote: Share of newly recruited public lower secondary school teachers who are female. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.AFR.FNTP.3.name: Africa Dataset: Newly recruited teachers. % female. Upper secondary. Public
UIS.AFR.FNTP.3.sourceNote: Share of newly recruited public upper secondary school teachers who are female. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.name: DHS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+ measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

LO.TIMSS.SCI4.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)
LO.TIMSS.SCI4.name: TIMSS:Mean performance on the science scale  for fourth grade students, total
LO.TIMSS.SCI4.sourceNote: TIMSS: Mean performance on the science scale for fourth grade students, total

UIS.TE_100000.56.name: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Total
UIS.TE_100000.56.sourceNote: Number of students in tertiary education per 100,000 inhabitants. Total is the number of students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year per 100,000 inhabitants. It is calculated by dividing the total number of students enrolled in tertiary education in a given academic year by the country’s population and multiplying the result by 100,000.

BAR.NOED.1519.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 15-19 with no education

BAR.PRM.SCHL.6064.name: average years of primary schooling, 60-64, total
BAR.PRM.SCHL.6064.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 60-64, total is the average years of primary education completed among people age 60-64.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.1519.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 15-19, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1519.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15-19, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 15-19.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.1519.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 15-19, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1519.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15-19, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 15-19.

MYS.PROP.80UP.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 80+, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.80UP.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 80+, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population over age 80 with secondary education.

SE.PRM.PRS5.ZS.name: Persistence to grade 5, total (% of cohort)
SE.PRM.PRS5.ZS.sourceNote: Survival rate to grade 5. Total is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method, which uses data on enrolment and repeaters for two consecutive years.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.6064.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.6064.name: average years of secondary schooling, 60-64, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.6064.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 60-64, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 60-64.

UIS.AFR.PBR.1.G3.PU.READ.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.POP.6064.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.6064.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 60-64, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.6064.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 60-64, female, tertiary is the total number of females age 60-64 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

SP.POP.AG17.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 17, male
SP.POP.AG17.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 17, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

BAR.POP.6064.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.6064.FE.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 60-64, female
BAR.POP.6064.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousands,60-64, female is the female population of 60-64 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

UIS.SR.2.GPV.GLAST.CP.M.name: Survival rate to last grade of lower secondary (General programmes). Male
UIS.SR.2.GPV.GLAST.CP.M.sourceNote: Survival rate to last grade of lower secondary (General programmes). Male is the share of male children enrolled in the first grade of secondary school who eventually reach the last grade of secondary school, regardless of repetition. To calculate this indicator, divide the total number of male pupils in the last grade of secondary education by the number of male pupils who originally enrolled in the first grade of secondary education, and multiply the result by 100. The survival rate is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method, which uses data on enrolment and repeaters for two consecutive years.

UIS.SR.2.GPV.GLAST.CP.F.name: Survival rate to last grade of lower secondary (General programmes). Female
UIS.SR.2.GPV.GLAST.CP.F.sourceNote: Survival rate to last grade of lower secondary (General programmes). Female is the share of female children enrolled in the first grade of secondary school who eventually reach the last grade of secondary school, regardless of repetition. To calculate this indicator, divide the total number of female pupils in the last grade of secondary education by the number of female pupils who originally enrolled in the first grade of secondary education, and multiply the result by 100. The survival rate is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method, which uses data on enrolment and repeaters for two consecutive years.

MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MF.name: proportion, 65-69, total, no education
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 65-69, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 65-69 with no education.

MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MA.name: proportion, 65-69, male, no education
MYS.PROP.6569.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 65-69, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 65-69 with no education.

UIS.T.3.V.F.name: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female
UIS.T.3.V.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

SP.POP.1418.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 14-18, female
SP.POP.1418.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 14-18, female is the total number of females age 14-18.

UIS.T.2.GPV.F.name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female
UIS.T.2.GPV.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in general programmes in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

MYS.POP.80UP.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.80UP.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 80+, female, secondary
MYS.POP.80UP.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 80+, female, secondary is the total number of females over age 80 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SE.SEC.PROG.ZS.name: Progression to secondary school (%)
SE.SEC.PROG.ZS.sourceNote: Transition from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2), general programmes (%). Total is the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary education (general programmes only) in a given year, expressed as a percentage of the number of pupils enrolled in the final grade of primary education in the previous year.

MYS.POP.25UP.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.25UP.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 25+, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.25UP.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25+, female, tertiary is the total number of females over age 25 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

SE.SEC.ENRR.MA.name: School enrollment, secondary, male (% gross)
SE.SEC.ENRR.MA.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Secondary. All programmes. Male is the total male enrollment in secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official secondary education age. GER can exceed 100% due to the inclusion of over-aged and under-aged students because of early or late school entrance and grade repetition.

UIS.FOSEP.56.F140.name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in education
UIS.FOSEP.56.F140.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in education is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in education programmes.

UIS.PTRHC.3.name: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Upper secondary
UIS.PTRHC.3.sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Upper secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in upper secondary school divided by the number of upper secondary school teachers.

UIS.PTRHC.2.name: Pupil-teacher ratio.  Lower secondary
UIS.PTRHC.2.sourceNote: Pupil-teacher ratio. Lower secondary is the number of pupils enrolled in lower secondary school divided by the number of lower secondary school teachers.

LO.TIMSS.MAT4.FE.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)
LO.TIMSS.MAT4.FE.name: TIMSS:Mean performance on the mathematics scale  for fourth grade students, female
LO.TIMSS.MAT4.FE.sourceNote: TIMSS: Mean performance on the mathematics scale for fourth grade students, female

SP.POP.AG19.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 19, total
SP.POP.AG19.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 19, total refers to the total population at the specified age.

UIS.E.23.AgI23.name: Pupils of the official school age.  Secondary.  Total
UIS.E.23.AgI23.sourceNote: Pupils of the official school age. Secondary. Total is the total number of secondary school students who are of the official secondary school age (ISCED 2 & 3). NOTE: These values are not ‘capped’ i.e. the values are not necessarily the numerators used to calculate the net enrolment rates (for cases that are capped). To obtain the numerator for the NER, you can simply multiply the SAP of a relevant level by its corresponding NER.

UIS.TRTP.0.F.name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Pre-primary.  Female
UIS.TRTP.0.F.sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Pre-primary. Female is the number of female teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the pre-primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of female teachers at the pre-primary level.

MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MF.name: population in thousand, 20 - 24, total, secondary
MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 20-24, total, secondary is the total number of people age 20-24 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MA.name: population in thousand, 20 - 24, male, secondary
MYS.POP.2024.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 20-24, male, secondary is the total number of males age 20-24 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SP.POP.1215.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 12-15, male
SP.POP.1215.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 12-15, male is the total number of males age 12-15.

UIS.TRTP.0.M.name: Percentage of trained teachers.  Pre-primary.  Male
UIS.TRTP.0.M.sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Pre-primary. Male is the number of male teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the pre-primary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male teachers at the pre-primary level.

BAR.TER.ICMP.2529.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.ICMP.2529.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 25-29 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)
BAR.TER.ICMP.2529.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 25-29 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)

MYS.POP.1564.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1564.NED.MA.name: population in thousand, 15-64, male, no education
MYS.POP.1564.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-64, male, no education is the total number of males age 15-64 (in thousands) with no education.

LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.FE.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.FE.name: PISA:Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), female
LO.PISA.MAT.HIG.FE.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), female is the percentage of female students at Level 6 (above 669.30 score points) on the mathematics scale.

MYS.POP.1564.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1564.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 15-64, total, no education
MYS.POP.1564.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-64, total, no education is the total number of people age 15-64 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MA.name: proportion, 80+, male, tertiary
MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 80+, male, tertiary is the proportion of the male population over age 80 with tertiary education.

UIS.LR.AG65.name: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Total
UIS.LR.AG65.sourceNote: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Total is the percentage of the population age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

SP.POP.AG05.FE.UN.name: Population, aged  5, female
SP.POP.AG05.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 5, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

UIS.LPP.AG15T99.name: Adult illiterate population. % female
UIS.LPP.AG15T99.sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. % female is the share of the adult illiterate population that is female.

MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MF.name: proportion, 80+, total, tertiary
MYS.PROP.80UP.TER.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 80+, total, tertiary is the proportion of the population over age 80 with tertiary education.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 45-49, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.4549.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 45-49, female is the average years of primary education completed among females age 45-49.

UIS.SLEN.12.GPI.name: Gender parity index for school life expectancy net of repetition. Primary to lower secondary
UIS.SLEN.12.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for school life expectancy net of repetition. Primary to lower secondary is the ratio of female to male vales for the indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

LO.PISA.REA.FE.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.REA.FE.name: PISA:Mean performance on the reading scale, female
LO.PISA.REA.FE.sourceNote: PISA: Mean performance on the reading scale, female is the average score of 15-year-old female students on combined reading literacy scale.

MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 25 - 29, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, total, secondary is the proportion of the population age 25-29 with secondary education.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.2024.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2024.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 20 - 24, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2024.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 20 - 24, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 20-24.

LO.PISA.REA.LOW.MA.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.REA.LOW.MA.name: PISA:Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), male
LO.PISA.REA.LOW.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), male is the percentage of male students below Level 1b (less than 262.04 score points) on the reading scale.

MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MA.name: proportion, 25 - 29, male, secondary
MYS.PROP.2529.SEC.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 25-29, male, secondary is the proportion of the male population age 25-29 with secondary education.

SE.PRM.TENR.name: Adjusted net enrollment rate, primary (% of primary school age children)
SE.PRM.TENR.sourceNote: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.

SP.POP.1014.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 10-14, male
SP.POP.1014.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10-14, male is the total number of males age 10-14.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 80+, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 80+, total is the mean years of schooling of the male population over age 80.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 80+, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.80UP.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 80+, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population over age 80.

MYS.POP.25UP.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.25UP.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 25+, female, secondary
MYS.POP.25UP.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25+, female, secondary is the total number of females over age 25 (in thousands) with secondary education.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.MA.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.MA.name: PASEC: 5th grade students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (less than 25% of answers correct) (%), male
LO.PASEC.MAT5.LO.MA.sourceNote: Indicator is for Failure Rate on the PASEC exam, which is less than the score a pupil could obtain by completing the PASEC test randomly.

MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 40-44, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.4044.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 40-44, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population age 40-44 with secondary education.

MYS.POP.2024.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.2024.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 20 - 24, female, no education
MYS.POP.2024.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 20-24, female, no education is the total number of females age 20-24 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.SR.1.G4.name: Survival rate to grade 4.  Total
UIS.SR.1.G4.sourceNote: Survival rate to grade 4. Total is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 4. The estimate is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method, which uses data on enrolment and repeaters for two consecutive years.

BAR.TER.ICMP.5054.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/

BAR.TER.ICMP.5054.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 50-54 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)

SP.POP.1117.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 11-17, male
SP.POP.1117.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 11-17, male is the total number of males age 11-17.

MYS.POP.4564.NED.MA.name: population in thousand, 45-64, male, no education
MYS.POP.4564.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, male, no education is the total number of males age 45-64 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.POP.4564.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 45-64, total, no education
MYS.POP.4564.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, total, no education is the total number of people age 45-64 (in thousands) with no education.

BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 15-19 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary
BAR.TER.CMPT.1519.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 15-19 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

LO.LLECE.MAT6.HIG.FE.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.MAT6.HIG.FE.name: LLECE: 6th grade students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), female
