SP.POP.1218.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 12-18, female
SP.POP.1218.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 12-18, female is the total number of females age 12-18.

MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.FE.name: proportion, 45-49, female, primary
MYS.PROP.4549.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, female, primary is the proportion of the female population age 45-49 with primary education.

SE.TER.TCHR.FE.name: Teaching staff in total tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female
SE.TER.TCHR.FE.sourceNote: Teaching staff in total tertiary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in public and private tertiary education institutions (ISCED 5 & 6). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

BAR.SCHL.4549.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SCHL.4549.name: average years of total schooling, 45-49, total
BAR.SCHL.4549.sourceNote: Average years of total schooling, 45-49, total is the average years of education completed among people age 45-49.

MYS.PROP.4549.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.4549.TER.FE.name: proportion, 45-49, female, tertiary
MYS.PROP.4549.TER.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 45-49, female, tertiary is the proportion of the female population age 45-49 with tertiary education.

HH.MICS.OOST.DO.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.name: MICS: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out
HH.MICS.OOST.DO.sourceNote: Typology of out-of-school children. Primary. Dropped out is the proportion of out-of-school children who were enrolled in school and dropped out. It is calculated as the proportion of children not classified as never-in-school expressed as a percent of the proportion of out-of-school children older than the age with the highest attendance rate.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q1.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 1
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q1.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 1 is the proportion of quintile 1 children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q3.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q3.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 3
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q3.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 3 is the proportion of quintile 3 children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q2.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q2.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 2
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q2.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 2 is the proportion of quintile 2 children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q5.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q5.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 5
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q5.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 5 is the proportion of quintile 5 children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q4.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q4.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 4
HH.MICS.NAR.1.Q4.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Quintile 4 is the proportion of quintile 4 children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

UIS.NER.23.GPI.name: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate.   Secondary
UIS.NER.23.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Secondary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for secondary to the male net enrolment rate for secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

MYS.POP.1519.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1519.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 15-19, female, no education
MYS.POP.1519.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-19, female, no education is the total number of females age 15-19 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.G.56.F400.dcount.name: Graduates in science. Tertiary. Total
UIS.G.56.F400.dcount.sourceNote: Graduates in science. Tertiary. Total is the total number of tertiary graduates from science programs.

HH.DHS.YRS.1519.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.M.name: DHS: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Male
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.M.sourceNote: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Male is the number of years of formal schooling received, on average, by the male population of the given age group.

SE.PRM.GINT.ZS.name: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education, total (% of relevant age group)
SE.PRM.GINT.ZS.sourceNote: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.

SE.PRM.AGES.name: Primary school starting age (years)
SE.PRM.AGES.sourceNote: Entrance age of primary is the age at which students would enter primary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.

SP.POP.1015.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 10-15, male
SP.POP.1015.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 10-15, male is the total number of males age 10-15.

UIS.DR.1.G3.F.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 3. Female
UIS.DR.1.G3.F.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 3. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

UIS.LR.AG65.F.name: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Female
UIS.LR.AG65.F.sourceNote: Elderly (65+) literacy rate (%). Female is the percentage of females age 65 and above who can, with understanding, read and write a short, simple statement on their everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations. This indicator is calculated by dividing the number of female literates aged 65 years and over by the corresponding age group population and multiplying the result by 100.

BAR.TER.SCHL.6064.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.SCHL.6064.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 60-64, total
BAR.TER.SCHL.6064.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 60-64, total is the average years of tertiary education completed among people age 60-64.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.7074.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 70-74 with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

UIS.ROFSPPT.1.M.name: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Male
UIS.ROFSPPT.1.M.sourceNote: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Male is total number of primary school age males who are enrolled in pre-primary education expressed as a percentage of the male primary school age population.

LO.PASEC.MAT5.MA.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.MA.name: PASEC: Mean performance on the mathematics scale (100 points) for 5th grade students, male
LO.PASEC.MAT5.MA.sourceNote: PASEC: Mean performance on the mathematics scale (100 points) for 5th grade students, male is the average score on the 100 point mathematics scale for male 5th grade students. Note: Average differences are only significant between males and females in Benin, Gabon, Burkina Faso, Senegal, Burundi, Cote d'Ivoire, and Comoros. Since comparison is suggested by giving average scores for males/females, please take into account that these are only raw effects of gender. PASEC uses econometric models to validate the effect of gender in achievement.

BAR.TER.CMPT.4044.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.CMPT.4044.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary
BAR.TER.CMPT.4044.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with tertiary schooling. Completed Tertiary

LO.LLECE.MAT6.MA.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.MAT6.MA.name: LLECE:Mean performance on the mathematics scale for 6th grade students, male
LO.LLECE.MAT6.MA.sourceNote: Mean performance on the mathematics scale for 6th grade students, male

UIS.ROFSPPT.1.F.name: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Female
UIS.ROFSPPT.1.F.sourceNote: Share of primary school-age children enrolled in pre-primary education (%). Female is total number of primary school age females who are enrolled in pre-primary education expressed as a percentage of the female primary school age population.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.15UP.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.15UP.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 15+ with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.15UP.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 15+ with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

BAR.PRM.SCHL.3034.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.3034.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 30-34, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.3034.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 30-34, female is the average years of primary education completed among females age 30-34.

UIS.AFR.CS.1.PU.name: Africa Dataset: Average class size. All classes. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.CS.1.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.OAPP.1.name: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total
UIS.OAPP.1.sourceNote: Over-age enrolment ratio. Primary. Total is the percentage of the primary school age population (ISCED 1) that is over the official primary school age.

MYS.POP.1544.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1544.PRI.MA.name: population in thousand, 15-44, male, primary
MYS.POP.1544.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-44, male, primary is the total number of males age 15-44 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.LP.AG15T99.name: Adult illiterate population. Total
UIS.LP.AG15T99.sourceNote: Adult illiterate population. Total is the total number of adults over age 15 who cannot both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on their everyday life.

MYS.POP.4549.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4549.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 45-49, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.4549.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-49, female, tertiary is the total number of females age 45-49 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

LO.SACMEQ.MAT.HIG.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.MAT.HIG.name: SACMEQ:Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%)
LO.SACMEQ.MAT.HIG.sourceNote: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%)

UIS.FOSEP.56.F700.name: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare
UIS.FOSEP.56.F700.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in health and welfare is the percentage of all tertiary students who are enrolled in health and welfare programmes.

SE.TER.GRAD.FE.ED.ZS.name: Female share of graduates in education (%, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.FE.ED.ZS.sourceNote: Female share of graduates in education (%, tertiary)

SE.SEC.TCAQ.MA.ZS.name: Secondary education, teachers (% trained), male
SE.SEC.TCAQ.MA.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of trained teachers. Total secondary. Male is the number of male teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching at the secondary level in the given country, expressed as a percentage of the total number of male teachers at the secondary level.

SP.POP.TOTL.FE.IN.sourceOrganization: World Bank estimates using ratio from UN World Population Prospects and World Bank's population.
SP.POP.TOTL.FE.IN.name: Population, female

UIS.thDur.4.A.GPV.name: Duration of 4A post-secondary
UIS.thDur.4.A.GPV.sourceNote: Duration of 4A post-secondary is the number of grades (years) in 4A post-secondary education.

MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MF.name: proportion, 55-59, total, no education
MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 55-59, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 55-59 with no education.

MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MA.name: proportion, 55-59, male, no education
MYS.PROP.5559.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 55-59, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 55-59 with no education.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.name: average years of secondary schooling, 70-74, total
BAR.SEC.SCHL.7074.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 70-74, total is the average years of secondary education completed among people age 70-74.

HH.MICS.NAR.23.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.23.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Secondary
HH.MICS.NAR.23.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Secondary is the proportion of children of official secondary school age who are attending secondary school.

HH.MICS.OOS.1.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.OOS.1.F.name: MICS: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Female
HH.MICS.OOS.1.F.sourceNote: Proportion of out-of-school. Primary. Female is the number of female children in the official primary school age range who are not attending primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of female children of the official primary school age range. By definition, children in the official primary-age range, who are attending pre-primary education, are considered out-of-school. The sum of the net primary attendance rate and the proportion out of school do not add to 100 percent because the net primary attendance rate does not count students who are in secondary.

BAR.SEC.ICMP.25UP.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.ICMP.25UP.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 25+ with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)
BAR.SEC.ICMP.25UP.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 25+ with secondary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Secondary)

SP.POP.AG18.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 18, male
SP.POP.AG18.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 18, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

SP.POP.0611.TO.UN.name: Population, aged 6-11, total
SP.POP.0611.TO.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 6-11, total is the total population age 6-11.

MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MF.name: proportion, 15-19, total, no education
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-19, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 15-19 with no education.

UIS.R.1.F.name: Repeaters in primary. All grades.  Female
UIS.R.1.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. All grades. Female is the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MA.name: proportion, 15-19, male, no education
MYS.PROP.1519.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-19, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 15-19 with no education.

HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q1.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 1
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q1.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 1 is the number of new quintile 1 pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 1 population of official entrance age to primary education.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 50-54 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 50-54 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q3.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q3.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 3
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q3.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 3 is the number of new quintile 3 pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 3 population of official entrance age to primary education.

HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q2.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q2.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 2
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q2.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 2 is the number of new quintile 2 pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 2 population of official entrance age to primary education.

HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q5.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q5.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 5
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q5.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 5 is the number of new quintile 5 pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 5 population of official entrance age to primary education.

HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q4.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q4.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 4
HH.MICS.NIR.1.Q4.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education. Quintile 4 is the number of new quintile 4 pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the quintile 4 population of official entrance age to primary education.

UIS.TRTP.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Primary
UIS.TRTP.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Primary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for primary to the male percentage of trained teachers for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.

UIS.REPP.3.GPV.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Male
UIS.REPP.3.GPV.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in upper secondary. All grades. Male is the number of male students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all male students enrolled in upper secondary school. It is calculated by dividing the sum of male repeaters in all grades of upper secondary education by the total male enrolment of upper secondary education and multiplying the result by 100.

UIS.R.1.G1.F.name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1.  Female
UIS.R.1.G1.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Female is the female number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.ZS.name: Secondary education, teachers (% female)
SE.SEC.TCHR.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage female teachers. Secondary is the number of female teachers at the secondary level expressed as a percentage of the total number of teachers (male and female) at the secondary level in a given school year. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

MYS.PROP.2024.SEC.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.2024.SEC.MF.name: proportion, 20 - 24, total, secondary
MYS.PROP.2024.SEC.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 20-24, total, secondary is the proportion of the population age 20-24 with secondary education.

SE.TER.GRAD.HU.ZS.name: Graduates in humanities and arts (% of total graduates, tertiary)
SE.TER.GRAD.HU.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of tertiary graduates in humanities and arts is the share of all tertiary graduates who studied humanities and arts.

MYS.POP.1564.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.1564.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 15-64, female, primary
MYS.POP.1564.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 15-64, female, primary is the total number of females age 15-64 (in thousands) with primary education.

SP.POP.1524.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 15-24, female
SP.POP.1524.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 15-24, female is the total number of females age 15-24.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 25-29.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.2529.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 25 - 29, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 25-29.

LO.TIMSS.MAT4.BL.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)'s Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
LO.TIMSS.MAT4.BL.name: TIMSS: Fourth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark of mathematics achievement (%)
LO.TIMSS.MAT4.BL.sourceNote: TIMSS: Fourth grade students who did not reach the low international benchmark of mathematics achievement (%) is the share of 4th grade students scoring below 400 on the mathematics assessment. This indicator is calculated by subtracting the share of students reaching the low international benchmark from 100.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G1.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 1. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G5.F.name: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Female
UIS.R.23.GPV.G5.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.M.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Male
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.M.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Male is the total number of male pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total male enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of male pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the male number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

SE.SEC.TCHR.MA.name: Teaching staff in total secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Male
SE.SEC.TCHR.MA.sourceNote: Teaching staff in total secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Male is the total number of male teachers in public and private secondary education institutions (ISCED 2 and 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

LO.PISA.REA.HIG.FE.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.REA.HIG.FE.name: PISA:Students at the highest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), female
LO.PISA.REA.HIG.FE.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%), female is the percentage of female students at Level 6 (above 698.32 score points) on the reading scale.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G3.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 3. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.E.3.PU.F.name: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. All programmes. Female
UIS.E.3.PU.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in upper secondary. Public. All programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in public upper secondary education institutions.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 50-54 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5054.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 50-54 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

SP.POP.GROW.sourceOrganization: Derived from total population. Population source: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Report (various years), (3) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (4) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (5) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme, and (6) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database..
SP.POP.GROW.name: Population growth (annual %)
SP.POP.GROW.sourceNote: Population growth (annual %) is the exponential rate of growth of midyear population from year t-1 to t, expressed as a percentage.

UIS.REPR.1.G3.name: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 3. Total
UIS.REPR.1.G3.sourceNote: Repetition rate in primary. Grade 3. Total is the proportion of pupils from a cohort enrolled in a given grade at a given school year who study in the same grade in the following school year.

UIS.SLE.123.F.name: School life expectancy (years).  Primary to secondary.  Female
UIS.SLE.123.F.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

MYS.POP.4549.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4549.NED.FE.name: population in thousand, 45-49, female, no education
MYS.POP.4549.NED.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-49, female, no education is the total number of females age 45-49 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.XCURP.2.name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Lower secondary
UIS.XCURP.2.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Lower secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to lower secondary education.

MYS.PROP.7074.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.7074.PRI.FE.name: proportion, 70-74, female, primary
MYS.PROP.7074.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 70-74, female, primary is the proportion of the female population age 70-74 with primary education.

UIS.SLE.123.M.name: School life expectancy (years).  Primary to secondary.  Male
UIS.SLE.123.M.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Primary to secondary. Male is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.M.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.M.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Male
HH.MICS.NAR.1.M.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Male is the proportion of male children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

SE.SEC.ENRR.UP.MA.name: Gross enrolment ratio. Upper secondary. All programmes. Male
SE.SEC.ENRR.UP.MA.sourceNote: Gross enrolment ratio. Upper secondary. All programmes. Male is the total male enrollment in upper secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the male population of official upper secondary education age.

SE.SEC.PROG.FE.ZS.name: Progression to secondary school, female (%)
SE.SEC.PROG.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Transition from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2), general programmes (%). Female is the number of new female entrants to the first grade of secondary education (general programmes only) in a given year, expressed as a percentage of the number of female pupils enrolled in the final grade of primary education in the previous year.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 55-59, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 55-59, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 55-59.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.F.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Female
HH.MICS.NAR.1.F.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Female is the proportion of female children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

LO.PISA.MAT.LOW.MA.sourceOrganization: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment
LO.PISA.MAT.LOW.MA.name: PISA:Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), male
LO.PISA.MAT.LOW.MA.sourceNote: PISA: Students at the lowest level of proficiency on the mathematics scale (%), male is the percentage of male students below Level 1 (below 357.77 score points) on the mathematics scale.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 55-59, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.5559.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 55-59, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 55-59.

SL.TLF.PRIM.ZS.sourceOrganization: International Labour Organization, Key Indicators of the Labour Market database.
SL.TLF.PRIM.ZS.name: Labor force with primary education (% of total)
SL.TLF.PRIM.ZS.sourceNote: Labor force with primary education is the proportion of the labor force that has a primary education, as a percentage of the total labor force.

UIS.NIRA.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for adjusted net intake rate. Primary
UIS.NIRA.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for adjusted net intake rate. Primary is the ratio of the female adjusted net intake rate for primary to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 60-64, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.6064.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 60-64, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population age 60-64 with secondary education.

BAR.PRM.CMPT.5559.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5559.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 55-59 with primary schooling. Completed Primary
BAR.PRM.CMPT.5559.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 55-59 with primary schooling. Completed Primary

UIS.R.1.G3.F.name: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3.  Female
UIS.R.1.G3.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in primary. Grade 3. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.U.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Urban
HH.MICS.NAR.1.U.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Urban is the proportion of urban children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

BAR.SEC.SCHL.6569.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.SEC.SCHL.6569.FE.name: average years of secondary schooling, 65-69, female
BAR.SEC.SCHL.6569.FE.sourceNote: Average years of secondary schooling, 65-69, female is the average years of secondary education completed among females age 65-69.

UIS.E.5.A.F.name: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
UIS.E.5.A.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in 5A tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private 5A tertiary education institutions. ISCED 5A tertiary education is defined as tertiary programmes that are largely theoretically based and are intended to provide sufficient qualifications for gaining entry into advanced research programmes and profession with high skills requirements.

UIS.FOSEP.56.F400.F.name: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in science
UIS.FOSEP.56.F400.F.sourceNote: Percentage of female tertiary enrolments (ISCED 5 and 6) in science is the percentage of all female tertiary students who are enrolled in science programmes.

HH.MICS.NAR.1.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NAR.1.R.name: MICS: Net attendance rate. Primary. Rural
HH.MICS.NAR.1.R.sourceNote: Net attendance rate. Primary. Rural is the proportion of rural children of the official primary school age who are attending primary school. The primary school age is based on the parameters of the educational system: starting age and duration of primary school.

LO.SACMEQ.REA.MA.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.REA.MA.name: SACMEQ:Mean performance on the reading scale, male
LO.SACMEQ.REA.MA.sourceNote: SACMEQ: Mean performance on the mathematics scale, male is the mean mathematics score for male 6th grade students. Mean scores are on SACMEQ scales for reading, which have averages of 500 and standard deviations of 100.

BAR.TER.ICMP.4549.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.ICMP.4549.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of population age 45-49 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)
BAR.TER.ICMP.4549.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of population age 45-49 with tertiary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Tertiary)

BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 25+, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.25UP.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 25+, female is the average years of primary education completed among females over age 25.

BAR.POP.6064.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.6064.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 60-64, total
BAR.POP.6064.sourceNote: Population in thousands,60-64, total is the total population of 60-64 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.CD.sourceOrganization: World Bank, International Comparison Program database.
NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.CD.name: GDP, PPP (current international $)
NY.GDP.MKTP.PP.CD.sourceNote: PPP GDP is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates. An international dollar has the same purchasing power over GDP as the U.S. dollar has in the United States. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. Data are in current international dollars. For most economies PPP figures are extrapolated from the 2011 International Comparison Program (ICP) benchmark estimates or imputed using a statistical model based on the 2011 ICP. For 47 high- and upper middle-income economies conversion factors are provided by Eurostat and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD).

MYS.POP.65UP.PRI.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.65UP.PRI.FE.name: population in thousand, 65+, female, primary
MYS.POP.65UP.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 65+, female, primary is the total number of females over age 65 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.XCURP.4.name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Post secondary
UIS.XCURP.4.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education by level. Post secondary is the share of public current education expenditure that is devoted to post-secondary education.

SP.POP.0511.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 5-11, male

UIS.XGDP.0.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Pre-primary
UIS.XGDP.0.FSGOV.FDINSTADM.FFD.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Public sources. Pre-primary is the expenditure coming from public sources spent on pre-primary education expressed as a % of GDP.

UIS.R.23.GPV.name: Repeaters in secondary. All grades. Total
UIS.R.23.GPV.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. All grades. Total is the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.name: DHS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Rural
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.R.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Rural measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.name: DHS: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Urban
HH.DHS.YRS.15UP.GIN.U.sourceNote: Gini coefficient of average years of schooling. Age 15+. Urban measures the degree of inequality in years of schooling in a society. It is calculated similarly to the Gini coefficient of income or wealth. Results range from 0 to 100 with 0 indicating perfect equality and 100 indicating perfect inequality.

UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.G1.PU.name: Africa Dataset: Average class size. Single grade classes. Grade 1. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.CS.SG.1.G1.PU.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.POP.3034.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.3034.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 30 - 34, female, secondary
MYS.POP.3034.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 30-34, female, secondary is the total number of females age 30-34 (in thousands) with secondary education.

SE.PRM.PRS5.MA.ZS.name: Persistence to grade 5, male (% of cohort)
SE.PRM.PRS5.MA.ZS.sourceNote: Survival rate to grade 5. Male is the share of male children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is calculated on the basis of the reconstructed cohort method, which uses data on enrolment and repeaters for two consecutive years.

LO.TIMSS.SCI8.INT.sourceOrganization: International Association for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (IEA)'s Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
LO.TIMSS.SCI8.INT.name: TIMSS: Eighth grade students reaching the intermediate international benchmark of science achievement (%)
LO.TIMSS.SCI8.INT.sourceNote: TIMSS: Eighth grade students reaching the intermediate international benchmark of science achievement (%) is the share of 8th grade students scoring at least 475 on the science assessment. Students at this benchmark can recognize and apply their understanding of basic scientific knowledge in various contexts. Students apply knowledge and communicate an understanding of human health, life cycles, adaptation, and heredity, and analyze information about ecosystems. They have some knowledge of chemistry in everyday life and elementary knowledge of properties of solutions and the concept of concentration. They are acquainted with some aspects of force, motion, and energy. They demonstrate an understanding of Earth’s processes and physical features, including the water cycle and atmosphere. Students interpret information from tables, graphs, and pictorial diagrams and draw conclusions. They apply knowledge to practical situations and communicate their understanding through brief descriptive responses.

UIS.NIR.1.AGP1.F.name: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Female
UIS.NIR.1.AGP1.F.sourceNote: Net intake rate. Primary. Over age (+1). Female is the number of new female entrants in the first grade of primary education who are one year older than the official primary school-entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the female population of the primary school entrance age.

UIS.REPP.1.G5.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 5. Total
UIS.REPP.1.G5.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 5. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

MYS.POP.25UP.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.25UP.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 25+, total, no education
MYS.POP.25UP.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 25+, total, no education is the total number of people over age 25 (in thousands) with no education.

UIS.REPP.1.G7.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Total
UIS.REPP.1.G7.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 7. Total is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.1.G6.name: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 6. Total
UIS.REPP.1.G6.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 6. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

UIS.REPP.1.G1.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in primary. Grade 1. Total is the total number of pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

LO.SACMEQ.MAT.FE.sourceNote: SACMEQ: Mean performance on the mathematics scale, female is the mean mathematics score for female 6th grade students. Mean scores are on SACMEQ scales for reading, which have averages of 500 and standard deviations of 100.

LO.PASEC.FRE5.sourceNote: PASEC: Mean performance on the French language scale (100 points) for 5th grade students, total is the average score on the 100 point French language scale for 5th grade students.

UIS.XCURP.UK.name: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education not allocated by level
UIS.XCURP.UK.sourceNote: Percentage distribution of public current expenditure on education not allocated by level is the share of public current education expenditure that is not devoted to a specified level of education.

UIS.AFR.GTCTR.3.T.name: Africa Dataset: Ratio of teacher training graduates to teachers in service. Upper secondary. Public and private. Total
UIS.AFR.GTCTR.3.T.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.ECDP.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience
UIS.ECDP.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience is the ratio of the female percentage of new entrants to primary education with ECCE experience to the male value for the same indicator. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

HH.MICS.NIR.1.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Multiple Cluster Indicator Survey (MICS) data
HH.MICS.NIR.1.name: MICS: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education
HH.MICS.NIR.1.sourceNote: Net intake rate for the first grade of primary education is the number of new pupils attending the first grade of primary education who are of the official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the children of official entrance age to primary education.

SE.PRM.NENR.name: School enrollment, primary (% net)
SE.PRM.NENR.sourceNote: Net enrolment rate. Primary. Total is the ratio of children of the official primary school age who are enrolled in primary school to the total population of the official primary school age.

UIS.DR.1.G2.F.name: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 2. Female
UIS.DR.1.G2.F.sourceNote: Drop-out rate. Primary. Grade 2. Female is the proportion of female pupils from a cohort enrolled in primary education in a given school year who are no longer enrolled in the following school year.

UIS.NER.1.GPI.name: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate.   Primary
UIS.NER.1.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for net enrolment rate. Primary is the ratio of female net enrolment rate for primary to the male net enrolment rate for primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of males and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of females.

UIS.AFR.GTCTR.3.F.sourceNote: Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

MYS.PROP.6569.PRI.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 65-69, female, primary is the proportion of the female population age 65-69 with primary education.

UIS.T.2.V.F.name: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female
UIS.T.2.V.F.sourceNote: Teaching staff in lower secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. Technical/vocational programmes. Female is the total number of female teachers in technical/vocational programmes in public and private lower secondary education institutions (ISCED 2). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

SP.POP.AG22.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 22, male
SP.POP.AG22.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 22, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

UIS.XPUBP.4.name: Educational expenditure in post secondary as % of total educational expenditure
UIS.XPUBP.4.sourceNote: Educational expenditure in post secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for post secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.

UIS.E.6.F.name: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female
UIS.E.6.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Female is the total number of female students enrolled at public and private ISCED 6 tertiary education institutions. This level is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on course-work only.

UIS.XPUBP.0.name: Educational expenditure in pre-primary as % of total educational expenditure
UIS.XPUBP.0.sourceNote: Educational expenditure in pre-primary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for pre-primary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.

UIS.XPUBP.3.name: Educational expenditure in upper secondary as % of total educational expenditure
UIS.XPUBP.3.sourceNote: Educational expenditure in upper secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for upper secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.

UIS.XPUBP.2.name: Educational expenditure in lower secondary as % of total educational expenditure
UIS.XPUBP.2.sourceNote: Educational expenditure in lower secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for lower secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.
