MYS.MEA.YSCH.1564.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15-64, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population age 15-64.

MYS.POP.3539.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.3539.SEC.FE.name: population in thousand, 35-39, female, secondary
MYS.POP.3539.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 35-39, female, secondary is the total number of females age 35-39 (in thousands) with secondary education.

MYS.POP.4044.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4044.TER.FE.name: population in thousand, 40-44, female, tertiary
MYS.POP.4044.TER.FE.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 40-44, female, tertiary is the total number of females age 40-44 (in thousands) with tertiary education.

UIS.AFR.TRNTP.3.PU.F.name: Africa Dataset: Newly recruited teachers. % trained. Upper secondary. Public. Female
UIS.AFR.TRNTP.3.PU.F.sourceNote: Share of newly recruited female public upper secondary school teachers who have been trained. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

UIS.E.6.name: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total
UIS.E.6.sourceNote: Enrolment in 6 tertiary. Public and private. Full and part time. Total is the total number of students enrolled at public and private ISCED 6 tertiary education institutions. This level is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on course-work only.

MYS.PROP.7579.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.7579.NED.FE.name: proportion, 75-79, female, no education
MYS.PROP.7579.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 75-79, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 75-79 with no education.

UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WOPOWAT.name: Africa Dataset: Percentage of schools without potable water. Primary. Public
UIS.AFR.SCHBSP.1.PU.WOPOWAT.sourceNote: Share of primary schools without a drinking water facility or water delivery point that is designed to protect water from external contamination, particularly of fecal origin. Examples of potable drinking water facilities include pipe-borne water, protected well, borehole, protected spring water and rainwater. Data available for African countries only. For more information, consult to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics' Regional Data Collections page.

BAR.PRM.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)
BAR.PRM.ICMP.4044.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 40-44 with primary schooling. Total (Incomplete and Completed Primary)

UIS.T.3.GPV.name: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Total
UIS.T.3.GPV.sourceNote: Teaching staff in upper secondary. Public and private. Full and part-time. General programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in general programmes in public and private upper secondary education institutions (ISCED 3). Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

LO.LLECE.SCI6.sourceOrganization: Latin American Laboratory for Assessment of the Quality of Education (LLECE)
LO.LLECE.SCI6.name: LLECE:Mean performance on the science scale for 6th grade students, total
LO.LLECE.SCI6.sourceNote: Mean performance on the science scale for 6th grade students, total

LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.FE.sourceOrganization: Programme d'Analyse des Systèmes Educatifs de la CONFEMEN/Program on the Analysis of Education Systems
LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.FE.name: PASEC: 5th grade students above the Knowledge Base Rate on the mathematics scale (above 40% of answers correct) (%), female
LO.PASEC.MAT5.HIG.FE.sourceNote: Indicator is the share of female students who score above the Knowledge Base Rate, which is the proportion of pupils who achieve a minimum learning goal, based on the programs of the level selected, appropriate to the scale of the tests used.

BAR.TER.SCHL.7074.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.TER.SCHL.7074.name: average years of tertiary schooling, 70-74, total
BAR.TER.SCHL.7074.sourceNote: Average years of tertiary schooling, 70-74, total is the average years of tertiary education completed among people age 70-74.

SP.POP.AG04.MA.UN.name: Population, aged  4, male
SP.POP.AG04.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 4, male refers to the male population at the specified age.

UIS.TRANRA.23.GPV.F.name: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Female
UIS.TRANRA.23.GPV.F.sourceNote: Effective transition rate from primary (ISCED 1) to secondary (ISCED 2). General programmes (%). Female shows the real transition from primary to secondary regardless of repetition. This indicator better reflects situations in which pupils repeat the last grade of primary but eventually make the transition to secondary. It is defined for a given year as the number of new female entrants to the first grade of secondary in the following year expressed as a percentage of the female students enrolled in the last grade of primary education in the given year who do not repeat that grade the following year.

LO.SACMEQ.REA.HIG.sourceOrganization: Southern and Eastern Africa Consortium for Monitoring Educational Quality (SACMEQ) Data Archive, www.sacmeq.org
LO.SACMEQ.REA.HIG.name: SACMEQ:Students at the highest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%)
LO.SACMEQ.REA.HIG.sourceNote: Students at the highest level of proficiency on the reading scale (%)

HH.DHS.YRS.1519.U.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.U.name: DHS: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Urban
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.U.sourceNote: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Urban is the number of years of formal schooling received, on average, by the urban population of the given age group.

HH.DHS.YRS.1519.R.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.R.name: DHS: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Rural
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.R.sourceNote: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Rural is the number of years of formal schooling received, on average, by the rural population of the given age group.

UIS.TRTP.0.GPI.name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Pre-primary
UIS.TRTP.0.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Pre-primary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for pre-primary to the male percentage of trained teachers for pre-primary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.

UIS.AIR.2.GPV.name: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Total
UIS.AIR.2.GPV.sourceNote: Gross entry ratio to lower secondary. General programmes. Total is the total number of new entrants to lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of theoretical entrance age to lower secondary education.

HH.DHS.YRS.1519.F.sourceOrganization: Porta (2011) using Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) data
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.F.name: DHS: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Female
HH.DHS.YRS.1519.F.sourceNote: Average years of schooling by age group. Age 15-19. Female is the number of years of formal schooling received, on average, by the female population of the given age group.

MYS.PROP.6569.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.6569.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 65-69, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.6569.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 65-69, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population age 65-69 with secondary education.

MYS.POP.3034.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.3034.NED.MF.name: population in thousand, 30 - 34, total, no education
MYS.POP.3034.NED.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 30-34, total, no education is the total number of people age 30-34 (in thousands) with no education.

MYS.POP.3034.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.3034.NED.MA.name: population in thousand, 30 - 34, male, no education
MYS.POP.3034.NED.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 30-34, male, no education is the total number of males age 30-34 (in thousands) with no education.

BAR.POP.1519.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.POP.1519.name: population in thousands (age 15+), 15-19, total
BAR.POP.1519.sourceNote: Population in thousands, 15-19, total is the total population of 15-19 year olds in thousands estimated by Barro-Lee.

MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MF.name: proportion, 15-64, total, no education
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MF.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, total, no education is the proportion of the population age 15-64 with no education.

MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MA.name: proportion, 15-64, male, no education
MYS.PROP.1564.NED.MA.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, male, no education is the proportion of the male population age 15-64 with no education.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MF.name: mean years of schooling, 15-44, total
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MF.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15-44, total is the mean years of schooling of the population age 15-44.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MA.name: mean years of schooling, 15-44, male
MYS.MEA.YSCH.1544.MA.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15-44, male is the mean years of schooling of the male population age 15-44.

SE.XPD.SECO.ZS.name: Share of public expenditure for secondary education (% of public education expenditure)
SE.XPD.SECO.ZS.sourceNote: Educational expenditure in secondary as % of total educational expenditure is the percentage of public education expenditure for secondary education. Public expenditure (current and capital) includes government spending on educational institutions (both public and private) and education administration as well as subsidies for private entities (students/households and other privates entities). In some instances data on public expenditure on education refers only to the ministry of education, excluding other ministries that spend a part of their budget on educational activities at a given level of education.

UIS.TRTP.23.GPI.name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Secondary
UIS.TRTP.23.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.

SP.POP.AG18.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 18, female
SP.POP.AG18.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 18, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

UIS.GGR.2.GPV.name: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Total
UIS.GGR.2.GPV.sourceNote: Gross lower secondary graduation ratio. General programmes. Total is the number of graduates regardless of age in general programmes of lower secondary education expressed as a percentage of the population at the theoretical graduation age in general programmes of lower secondary education.

UIS.E.2.GPV.F.name: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Female
UIS.E.2.GPV.F.sourceNote: Enrolment in lower secondary. Public and private. General programmes. Female is the total number of female students enrolled in general programmes at public and private lower secondary education institutions.

SP.POP.0406.FE.UN.name: Population, aged 4- 6, female
SP.POP.0406.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 4-6, female is the total number of females age 4-6.

UIS.TEP.6.name: Distribution of students (%).   ISCED Level 6
UIS.TEP.6.sourceNote: Distribution of students (%). Tertiary ISCED Level 6 is the enrolment in tertiary education at ISCED level 6 as a percentage of total enrolment in tertiary education. ISCED Level 6 is reserved for tertiary programmes which lead to the award of an advanced research qualification. The programmes are therefore devoted to advanced study and original research and are not based on coursework only. It typically requires the submission of a thesis or dissertation of publishable quality which is the product of original research and represents a significant contribution to knowledge. It prepares graduates for faculty posts in institutions offering ISCED 5A programmes, as well as research posts in government, industry, etc.

MYS.PROP.7074.NED.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.7074.NED.FE.name: proportion, 70-74, female, no education
MYS.PROP.7074.NED.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 70-74, female, no education is the proportion of the female population age 70-74 with no education.

MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.FE.name: proportion, 15-64, female, secondary
MYS.PROP.1564.SEC.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 15-64, female, secondary is the proportion of the female population age 15-64 with secondary education.

SP.POP.AG01.FE.UN.name: Population, aged  1, female
SP.POP.AG01.FE.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 1, female refers to the female population at the specified age.

SP.POP.0610.MA.UN.name: Population, aged 6-10, male
SP.POP.0610.MA.UN.sourceNote: Population, age 6-10, male is the total number of males age 6-10.

BAR.PRM.SCHL.75UP.FE.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.PRM.SCHL.75UP.FE.name: average years of primary schooling, 75+, female
BAR.PRM.SCHL.75UP.FE.sourceNote: Average years of primary schooling, 75+, female is the average years of primary education completed among females over age 75.

MYS.MEA.YSCH.15UP.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.MEA.YSCH.15UP.FE.name: mean years of schooling, 15+, female
MYS.MEA.YSCH.15UP.FE.sourceNote: Mean years of schooling, 15+, female is the mean years of schooling of the female population over age 15.

UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G5.F.name: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Female
UIS.REPP.23.GPV.G5.F.sourceNote: Percentage of repeaters in secondary. Grade 5. Female is the total number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade as in a previous year, expressed as a percentage of the total female enrollment in the specified grade. It is calculated by dividing the number of female pupils repeating a given grade in a given school year by the number of female pupils enrolled in the same grade in the same school year and multiplying by 100.

SE.PRM.TCHR.name: Primary education, teachers
SE.PRM.TCHR.sourceNote: Teaching staff in primary. Public and private. Full and part-time. All programmes. Total is the total number of teachers in public and private primary education institutions. Teachers are persons employed full time or part time in an official capacity to guide and direct the learning experience of pupils and students, irrespective of their qualifications or the delivery mechanism, i.e. face-to-face and/or at a distance. This definition excludes educational personnel who have no active teaching duties (e.g. headmasters, headmistresses or principals who do not teach) and persons who work occasionally or in a voluntary capacity in educational institutions.

UIS.SLE.56.F.name: School life expectancy (years).  Tertiary.  Female
UIS.SLE.56.F.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Female is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

UIS.R.23.GPV.G8.F.name: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Female
UIS.R.23.GPV.G8.F.sourceNote: Repeaters in secondary. Grade 8. Female is the number of female pupils in the specified grade who are enrolled in the same grade for a second (or further) year.

BAR.NOED.3539.FE.ZS.sourceOrganization: Robert J. Barro and Jong-Wha Lee: http://www.barrolee.com/
BAR.NOED.3539.FE.ZS.name: Barro-Lee: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with no education
BAR.NOED.3539.FE.ZS.sourceNote: Percentage of female population age 35-39 with no education

UIS.E.56.F300.name: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Total
UIS.E.56.F300.sourceNote: Enrolment in social sciences, business and law. Tertiary. Total is the total number of students enrolled in tertiary social sciences, business and law programs.

UIS.XGDP.0.FSpr.FDinst.FFd.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Pre-primary
UIS.XGDP.0.FSpr.FDinst.FFd.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. Pre-primary is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on pre-primary education expressed as a % of GDP.

SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.ZS.name: Vocational and Technical enrollment (% of total secondary enrollment), total
SE.SEC.ENRL.VO.ZS.sourceNote: Technical/vocational enrolment in secondary (ISCED 2 and 3) as % of total secondary enrolment (ISCED 2 and 3) is the percentage of all lower and upper secondary students enrolled in technical/vocational education programs including teacher training, expressed as a percentage of the total number of students who are enrolled in lower and upper secondary education.

UIS.SLE.56.M.name: School life expectancy (years).  Tertiary.  Male
UIS.SLE.56.M.sourceNote: School life expectancy (years). Tertiary. Male is the total number of years of schooling which a child of a certain age can expect to receive in the future, assuming that the probability of his or her being enrolled in school at any particular age is equal to the current enrollment ratio for that age. For a child of a certain age a, the school life expectancy is calculated as the sum of the age specific enrolment rates for the levels of education specified. The part of the enrolment that is not distributed by age is divided by the school-age population for the level of education they are enrolled in, and multiplied by the duration of that level of education. The result is then added to the sum of the age-specific enrolment rates. The expected number of years does not necessarily coincide with the expected number of grades of education completed because of repetition.

UIS.TRTP.3.GPI.name: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers.  Upper secondary
UIS.TRTP.3.GPI.sourceNote: Gender parity index for % of trained teachers. Upper secondary is the ratio of the female percentage of trained teachers for upper secondary to the male percentage of trained teachers for upper secondary. It is calculated by dividing the female value for the indicator by the male value for the indicator. A GPI equal to 1 indicates parity between females and males. In general, a value less than 1 indicates disparity in favor of men and a value greater than 1 indicates disparity in favor of women.

MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MF.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MF.name: population in thousand, 45-64, total, primary
MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MF.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, total, primary is the total number of people age 45-64 (in thousands) with primary education.

MYS.PROP.7074.TER.FE.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.PROP.7074.TER.FE.name: proportion, 70-74, female, tertiary
MYS.PROP.7074.TER.FE.sourceNote: Proportion, 70-74, female, tertiary is the proportion of the female population age 70-74 with tertiary education.

MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MA.sourceOrganization: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)/Vienna Institute of Demography (VID)
MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MA.name: population in thousand, 45-64, male, primary
MYS.POP.4564.PRI.MA.sourceNote: Population in thousand, 45-64, male, primary is the total number of males age 45-64 (in thousands) with primary education.

UIS.XGDP.FSpr.FDinst.FFd.name: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. All levels
UIS.XGDP.FSpr.FDinst.FFd.sourceNote: Total expenditure on educational institutions and administration as a % of GDP. Private sources. All levels is the expenditure coming from private sources spent on education expressed as a % of GDP.
